When you finally close the cover, the characters have told their story and you start up again with another book, complete with new characters and adventures. Then you find yourself focusing on the new ones, not the ones from the past.”
Author: Nicholas Sparks,

Quotes: “As it has been said:
Author: Anne Sexton

Quotes: “When you laugh, laugh like hell. And when you get angry, get good and angry. Try to be alive. You will be dead soon enough.”
Author: William Saroyan

Quotes: “We are the music makers, and we are the dreamers of dreams.”
Author: Arthur William Edgar O'Shaughnessy,

Quotes: “Crying is for plain women. Pretty women go shopping.”
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: “Happiness consists in getting enough sleep. Just that, nothing more.”
Author: Robert A. Heinlein,

Quotes: “I am glad you are here with me. Here at the end of all things, Sam.”
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,

Quotes: “I cannot go to school today"
Author: Shel Silverstein

Quotes: “Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and to have her nonsense respected.”
Author: Charles Lamb,

Quotes: “The reason it hurts so much to separate is because our souls are connected. Maybe they always have been and will be. Maybe we've lived a thousand lives before this one and in each of them we've found each other. And maybe each time, we've been forced apart for the same reasons. That means that this goodbye is both a goodbye for the past ten thousand years and a prelude to what will come.”
Author: Nicholas Sparks,

Quotes: “Have you really read all those books in your room?”
Author: John Green,

Quotes: “I am too fond of reading books to care to write them.”
Author: Oscar Wilde,

Quotes: “No book can be appreciated until it has been slept with and dreamed over.”
Author: Eugene Field

Quotes: “Make your mistakes, take your chances, look silly, but keep on going. Don’t freeze up.”
Author: Thomas Wolfe,

Quotes: “I like flaws. I think they make things interesting.”
Author: Sarah Dessen,

Quotes: “Hope can be a powerful force. Maybe there's no actual magic in it, but when you know what you hope for most and hold it like a light within you, you can make things happen, almost like magic.”
Author: Laini Taylor,

Quotes: “the free soul is rare, but you know it when you see it - basically because you feel good, very good, when you are near or with them.”
Author: Charles Bukowski,

Quotes: “In order to rise
Author: Octavia Butler,

Quotes: “Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.”
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: “It is easy to love people in memory; the hard thing is to love them when they are there in front of you.”
Author: John Updike,

Quotes: “Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.”
Author: Elie Wiesel

Quotes: “Always find opportunities to make someone smile, and to offer random acts of kindness in everyday life.”
Author: Roy T. Bennett,

Quotes: “The longer and more carefully we look at a funny story, the sadder it becomes.”
Author: Nikolai V. Gogol

Quotes: “When people talk, listen completely. Most people never listen.”
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: “What do you want?"
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “Beauty is terror. Whatever we call beautiful, we quiver before it.”

Quotes: “Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.”

Quotes: “What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?”

Quotes: “You see I usually find myself among strangers because I drift here and there trying to forget the sad things that happened to me.”

Quotes: “Lost love is still love. It takes a different form, that's all. You can't see their smile or bring them food or tousle their hair or move them around a dance floor. But when those senses weaken another heightens. Memory. Memory becomes your partner. You nurture it. You hold it. You dance with it.”

Quotes: “If we couldn't laugh we would all go insane.”

Quotes: “The trouble is if you don’t spend your life yourself, other people spend it for you.”

Quotes: “No one has ever become poor by giving.”

Quotes: “Peeta, how come I never know when you're having a nightmare?” I say.

Quotes: “Pretty women wonder where my secret lies.

Quotes: “I have the simplest tastes. I am always satisfied with the best.”

Quotes: “I like too many things and get all confused and hung-up running from one falling star to another till i drop. This is the night, what it does to you. I had nothing to offer anybody except my own confusion.”

Quotes: “That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence.”

Quotes: “You know, Hobbes, some days even my lucky rocket ship underpants don't help.”

Quotes: “Forgive, O Lord, my little jokes on Thee
Author: Robert Frost

Quotes: “The world is full of magic things, patiently waiting for our senses to grow sharper.”

Quotes: “People change and forget to tell each other.”

Quotes: “Thinking something does not make it true. Wanting something does not make it real.”

Quotes: “Remember if people talk behind your back, it only means you are two steps ahead.”

Quotes: “You know how they say you only hurt the ones you love? Well, it works both ways.”

Quotes: “Ginny!" said Mr. Weasley, flabbergasted. "Haven't I taught you anything? What have I always told you? Never trust anything that can think for itself if you can't see where it keeps its brain?”

Quotes: “I must have loved you a lot.”

Quotes: “Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment.”

Quotes: “How nice -- to feel nothing, and still get full credit for being alive.”
Author: Kurt Vonnegut,

Quotes: “It's the questions we can't answer that teach us the most. They teach us how to think. If you give a man an answer, all he gains is a little fact. But give him a question and he'll look for his own answers.”

Quotes: “That's what careless words do. They make people love you a little less.”

Quotes: “This was another of our fears: that Life wouldn't turn out to be like Literature.”

Quotes: “The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.”

Quotes: “No one can construct for you the bridge upon which precisely you must cross the stream of life, no one but you yourself alone.”

Quotes: “those who escape hell

Quotes: “Do not be afraid; our fate

Quotes: “Tears are words that need to be written.”

Quotes: “Jace shook his blond head in exasperation.
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “I travel not to go anywhere, but to go. I travel for travel's sake. The great affair is to move.”
Author: Robert Louis Stevenson,

Quotes: “Burdens are for shoulders strong enough to carry them.”

Quotes: “Every book, every volume you see here, has a soul. The soul of the person who wrote it and of those who read it and lived and dreamed with it. Every time a book changes hands, every time someone runs his eyes down its pages, its spirit grows and strengthens.”

Quotes: “Strange as it may seem, I still hope for the best, even though the best, like an interesting piece of mail, so rarely arrives, and even when it does it can be lost so easily.”

Quotes: “The greatness of a man is not in how much wealth he acquires, but in his integrity and his ability to affect those around him positively”

Quotes: “It must require bravery to be honest all the time.”

Quotes: “Good books tell the truth, even when they're about things that never have been and never will be. They're truthful in a different way.”

Quotes: “If you look the right way, you can see that the whole world is a garden.”

Quotes: “There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance.”

Quotes: “الكراهية تكلف أكثر من الحب.. لأنها إحساس غير طبيعي.. إحساس عكسي مثل حركة الأجسام ضد جاذبية الأرض.. تحتاج إلى قوة إضافية وتستهلك وقوداً أكثر”

Quotes: “Even the strongest and bravest must sometimes weep. It shows they have a great heart, one that can feel compassion for others.”

Quotes: “I used to dream about escaping my ordinary life, but my life was never ordinary. I had simply failed to notice how extraordinary it was.”

Quotes: “When one tugs at a single thing in nature, he finds it attached to the rest of the world.”

Quotes: “A library is infinity under a roof.”

Quotes: “It ain't what they call you, it's what you answer to.”

Quotes: “Courage is found in unlikely places.”

Quotes: “Time was passing like a hand waving from a train I wanted to be on.
Author: jonathan safran foer

Quotes: “It's not worth doing something unless someone, somewhere, would much rather you weren't doing it.”

Quotes: “You like someone who can't like you back because unrequited love can be survived in a way that once-requited love cannot. ”

Quotes: “Stories can conquer fear, you know. They can make the heart bigger.”

Quotes: “When I saw you I fell in love, and you smiled because you knew.”

Quotes: “One word

Quotes: “Knowing too much of your future is never a good thing.”

Quotes: “You can make anything by writing.”

Quotes: “Boring damned people. All over the earth. Propagating more boring damned people. What a horror show. The earth swarmed with them.”
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quotes: “Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know.”

Quotes: “When I was your age, television was called books.”

Quotes: “It is never too late to be wise.”

Quotes: “We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.”

Quotes: “Sometimes, I feel the past and the future pressing so hard on either side that there's no room for the present at all.”

Quotes: “You must write every single day of your life... You must lurk in libraries and climb the stacks like ladders to sniff books like perfumes and wear books like hats upon your crazy heads... may you be in love every day for the next 20,000 days. And out of that love, remake a world.”
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quotes: “Black holes are where God divided by zero.”

Quotes: “Where you used to be, there is a hole in the world, which I find myself constantly walking around in the daytime, and falling in at night. I miss you like hell.”

Quotes: “Come sleep with me: We won't make Love, Love will make us.”

Quotes: “Life is not a matter of holding good cards, but of playing a poor hand well.”

Quotes: “Rare as is true love, true friendship is rarer.”

Quotes: “If you don't know history, then you don't know anything. You are a leaf that doesn't know it is part of a tree. ”

Quotes: “Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered, weak and weary,
Author: Edgar Allan Poe,

Quotes: “What happened down in the dungeons between you and Professor Quirrell is a complete secret, so, naturally the whole school knows.”
Author: J. K. Rowling,

Quotes: “If I’m honest I have to tell you I still read fairy-tales and I like them best of all.”

Quotes: “The creatures outside looked from pig to man, and from man to pig, and from pig to man again; but already it was impossible to say which was which.”

Quotes: “In the midst of winter, I found there was, within me, an invincible summer.

Quotes: “Being a writer is a very peculiar sort of a job: it's always you versus a blank sheet of paper (or a blank screen) and quite often the blank piece of paper wins.”

Quotes: “The trouble is not that I am single and likely to stay single, but that I am lonely and likely to stay lonely.”
Author: Charlotte Brontë

Quotes: “It's not the size of the dog in the fight, it's the size of the fight in the dog.”
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: “We are addicted to our thoughts. We cannot change anything if we cannot change our thinking.”
Author: Santosh Kalwar,

Quotes: “Lost opportunities, lost possibilities, feelings we can never get back. That's part of what it means to be alive. But inside our heads - at least that's where I imagine it - there's a little room where we store those memories. A room like the stacks in this library. And to understand the workings of our own heart we have to keep on making new reference cards. We have to dust things off every once in awhile, let in fresh air, change the water in the flower vases. In other words, you'll live forever in your own private library.”
Author: Haruki Murakami,

Quotes: “There are two means of refuge from the misery of life — music and cats.”
Author: Albert Schweitzer

Quotes: “It gives me strength to have somebody to fight for; I can never fight for myself, but, for others, I can kill.”
Author: Emilie Autumn,

Quotes: “I fell in love with her when we were together, then fell deeper in love with her in the years we were apart.”
Author: Nicholas Sparks,

Quotes: “so I wait for you like a lonely house
Author: Pablo Neruda,

Quotes: “I myself have never been able to find out precisely what feminism is: I only know that people call me a feminist whenever I express sentiments that differentiate me from a doormat.”
Author: Rebecca West

Quotes: “Did you see that dress?” "I saw the dress.” "Did you like it?” He didn't answer. I took that as a yes. "Am I going to endanger my reputation if I wear it to the dance?” When he spoke, I could barely hear him. "You'll endanger the school.” I smiled and fell asleep.”
Author: Richelle Mead,

Quotes: “And all the books you've read have been read by other people. And all the songs you've loved have been heard by other people. And that girl that's pretty to you is pretty to other people. and that if you looked at these facts when you were happy, you would feel great because you are describing 'unity.”
Author: Stephen Chbosky,

Quotes: “He thinks he'll be remembered as the villain in the story. But I forgot to tell him that the villain is usually the person who locks up the maiden and throws away the key. He was the one who let me out.”
Author: Sarah J. Maas,

Quotes: “Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose. You are already naked. There is no reason not to follow your heart.”
Author: Steve Jobs

Quotes: “Books have to be heavy because the whole world's inside them.”

Quotes: “[D]on't ever apologise to an author for buying something in paperback, or taking it out from a library (that's what they're there for.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quotes: “I don't like people who have never fallen or stumbled. Their virtue is lifeless and it isn't of much value. Life hasn't revealed its beauty to them. ”
Author: Boris Pasternak

Quotes: “The love of learning, the sequestered nooks,

Quotes: “Never lose hope. Storms make people stronger and never last forever.”

Quotes: “Do not read as children do to enjoy themselves, or, as the ambitious do to educate themselves. No, read to live.”

Quotes: “What she had realized was that love was that moment when your heart was about to burst.”

Quotes: “A smile is a curve that sets everything straight.”

Quotes: “No matter how careful you are, there's going to be the sense you missed something, the collapsed feeling under your skin that you didn't experience it all. There's that fallen heart feeling that you rushed right through the moments where you should've been paying attention.

Quotes: “The nitrogen in our DNA, the calcium in our teeth, the iron in our blood, the carbon in our apple pies were made in the interiors of collapsing stars. We are made of starstuff.”

Quotes: “I think that we're all mentally ill. Those of us outside the asylums only hide it a little better - and maybe not all that much better after all.”

Quotes: “You're a painter. You're a baker. You like to sleep with the windows open. You never take sugar in your tea. And you always double-knot your shoelaces.”

Quotes: “Trust your heart if the seas catch fire, live by love though the stars walk backward.”

Quotes: “When everything goes to hell, the people who stand by you without flinching -- they are your family. ”

Quotes: “My rapier wit hides my inner pain.”

Quotes: “Forbidden to remember, terrified to forget; it was a hard line to walk.”
Author: Stephenie Meyer,

Quotes: “If you have a sister and she dies, do you stop saying you have one? Or are you always a sister, even when the other half of the equation is gone?”

Quotes: “I know we're fucked up, alright? I'm impulsive, and hot tempered, and you get under my skin like no one else. You act like you hate me one minute, and then need me the next. I never get anything right, and I don't deserve you...but I fucking love you, Abby. I love you more than I loved anyone or anything ever. When you're around, I don't need booze, or money, or the fighting, or the one-night stands...”
Author: Jamie McGuire,

Quotes: “If you have good friends, no matter how much life is sucking , they can make you laugh.”

Quotes: “The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.”

Quotes: “Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul.”

Quotes: “The brick walls are there for a reason. The brick walls are not there to keep us out. The brick walls are there to give us a chance to show how badly we want something. Because the brick walls are there to stop the people who don’t want it badly enough. They’re there to stop the other people.”
Author: Randy Pausch,

Quotes: “Even strength must bow to wisdom sometimes.”
Author: Rick Riordan,

Quotes: “I'd rather die my way than live yours.”
Author: Lauren Oliver,

Quotes: “If you want to keep a secret, you must also hide it from yourself.”
Author: George Orwell,

Quotes: “I do not think, sir, you have any right to command me, merely because you are older than I, or because you have seen more of the world than I have; your claim to superiority depends on the use you have made of your time and experience.”
Author: Charlotte Brontë,

Quotes: “please believe that things are good with me, and even when they're not, they will be soon enough. And i will always believe the same about you.”
Author: Stephen Chbosky,

Quotes: “I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early.”
Author: Charles Lamb

Quotes: “A party without cake is just a meeting”

Quotes: “I am always saying "Glad to've met you" to somebody I'm not at all glad I met. If you want to stay alive, you have to say that stuff, though.”

Quotes: “Headline?" he asked.
Author: John Green,

Quotes: “Is there no way out of the mind?”
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quotes: “A woman's heart should be so hidden in God that a man has to seek Him just to find her.”
Author: Maya Angelou

Quotes: “When we don't know who to hate, we hate ourselves.”
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,

Quotes: “I will love you always. When this red hair is white, I will still love you. When the smooth softness of youth is replaced by the delicate softness of age, I will still want to touch your skin. When your face is full of the lines of every smile you have ever smiled, of every surprise I have seen flash through your eyes, when every tear you have ever cried has left its mark upon your face,I will treasure you all the more, because I was there to see it all. I will share your life with you, Meredith, and I will love you until the last breath leaves your body or mine.”
Author: Laurell K. Hamilton,

Quotes: “From childhood's hour I have not been. As others were, I have not seen. As others saw, I could not awaken. My heart to joy at the same tone. And all I loved, I loved alone.”
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quotes: “Morning is wonderful. Its only drawback is that it comes at such an inconvenient time of day.”
Author: Glen Cook,

Quotes: “In the end
Author: Jack Kornfield,

Quotes: “Very few of us are what we seem.”
Author: Agatha Christie,

Quotes: “It doesn't matter. I have books, new books, and I can bear anything as long as there are books.”
Author: Jo Walton,

Quotes: “Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way.”
Author: Steve Martin

Quotes: “I am only responsible for my own heart, you offered yours up for the smashing my darling. Only a fool would give out such a vital organ”
Author: Anais Nin

Quotes: “There are only the pursued, the pursuing, the busy and the tired.”
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,

Quotes: “Better a cruel truth than a comfortable delusion.”
Author: Edward Abbey

Quotes: “I kept always two books in my pocket, one to read, one to write in.”
Author: Robert Louis Stevenson,

Quotes: “Nothing great in the world was accomplished without passion.”
Author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

Quotes: “Don't let the bastards grind you down.”
Author: Margaret Atwood,

Quotes: “I get a warm feeling among my books.”
Author: Anthony Powell

Quotes: “Do not think that love in order to be genuine has to be extraordinary. What we need is to love without getting tired. Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.”
Author: Mother Teresa

Quotes: “The emotion that can break your heart is sometimes the very one that heals it...”
Author: Nicholas Sparks,

Quotes: “Remember me and smile, for it's better to forget than to remember me and cry.”
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quotes: “Behind every beautiful thing, there's some kind of pain.”
Author: Bob Dylan

Quotes: “Sometimes things fall apart so that better things can fall together”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quotes: “When the first baby laughed for the first time, its laugh broke into a thousand pieces, and they all went skipping about, and that was the beginning of fairies.”
Author: J.M. Barrie,

Quotes: “I hate to advocate drugs, alcohol, violence, or insanity to anyone, but they've always worked for me.”

Quotes: “Sometimes, when I have to do something I don't want to do, I pretend I'm a character from a book. It's easier to know what they would do.”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “Where words leave off, music begins.”
Author: Heinrich Heine

Quotes: “The more one judges, the less one loves.”
Author: Honoré de Balzac,

Quotes: “Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one's definition of your life, but define yourself.”

Quotes: “Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.”
Author: Mother Teresa

Quotes: “I don't think of all the misery, but of the beauty that still remains.”
Author: Anne Frank,

Quotes: “In individuals, insanity is rare; but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule.”
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: “One person's craziness is another person's reality.”
Author: Tim Burton

Quotes: “I know of a cure for everything: salt water...in one way or the other. Sweat, or tears, or the salt sea.”
Author: Karen Blixen

Quotes: “You are not special. You're not a beautiful and unique snowflake. You're the same decaying organic matter as everything else. We're all part of the same compost heap. We're all singing, all dancing crap of the world.”
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,

Quotes: “Sorrow is how we learn to love. Your heart isn't breaking. It hurts because it's getting larger. The larger it gets, the more love it holds.”
Author: Rita Mae Brown,

Quotes: “My course is set for an uncharted sea.”
Author: Dante Alighieri

Quotes: “If you're too open-minded; your brains will fall out.”
Author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti

Quotes: “Children have never been very good at listening to their elders, but they have never failed to imitate them.”
Author: James Baldwin

Quotes: “To choose doubt as a philosophy of life is akin to choosing immobility as a means of transportation.”
Author: Yann Martel,

Quotes: “An Unbreakable Vow?" said Ron, looking stunned. "Nah, he can’t have.... Are you sure?"
Author: J.K. Rowling,

Quotes: “The future is now. It's time to grow up and be strong. Tomorrow may well be too late.”
Author: Neil LaBute,

Quotes: “Books are easily destroyed. But words will live as long as people can remember them.”
Author: Tahereh Mafi,

Quotes: “It is good to have an end to journey toward; but it is the journey that matters, in the end.”
Author: Ursula K. Le Guin,

Quotes: “The only lies for which we are truly punished are those we tell ourselves.”
Author: V. S. Naipaul,

Quotes: “I hope you're pleased with yourselves. We could all have been killed - or worse, expelled. Now if you don't mind, I'm going to bed.”
Author: J.K. Rowling,

Quotes: “You do have a story inside you; it lies articulate and waiting to be written — behind your silence and your suffering.”
Author: Anne Rice

Quotes: “Writing is like sex. First you do it for love, then you do it for your friends, and then you do it for money.”
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: “Holding Eleanor's hand was like holding a butterfly. Or a heartbeat. Like holding something complete, and completely alive.”
Author: Rainbow Rowell,

Quotes: “I desire the things that will destroy me in the end.”
Author: Sylvia Plath,

Quotes: “To shine your brightest light is to be who you truly are.”
Author: Roy T. Bennett

Quotes: “Behind every exquisite thing that existed, there was something tragic.”
Author: Oscar Wilde,

Quotes: “It is one of life's bitterest truths that bedtime so often arrives just when things are really getting interesting.”
Author: Lemony Snicket,

Quotes: “The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.”
Author: Marcus Aurelius,

Quotes: “I've lived through some terrible things in my life, some of which actually happened.”
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: “Men are afraid that women will laugh at them. Women are afraid that men will kill them.”
Author: Margaret Atwood

Quotes: “Learn from the mistakes of others. You can never live long enough to make them all yourself.”
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: “It takes courage to love, but pain through love is the purifying fire which those who love generously know. We all know people who are so much afraid of pain that they shut themselves up like clams in a shell and, giving out nothing, receive nothing and therefore shrink until life is a mere living death.”
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quotes: “I have faith that God will show you the answer. But you have to understand that sometimes it takes a while to be able to recognize what God wants you to do. That's how it often is. God's voice is usually nothing more than a whisper, and you have to listen very carefully to hear it. But other times, in those rarest of moments, the answer is obvious and rings as loud as a church bell.”
Author: Nicholas Sparks,

Quotes: “They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.”
Author: Andy Warhol,

Quotes: “Selfishness is not living as one wishes to live, it is asking others to live as one wishes to live.”
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: “Let the first act of every morning be to make the following resolve for the day:
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes: “The moon is a loyal companion.
Author: Tahereh Mafi,

Quotes: “Better to die fighting for freedom then be a prisoner all the days of your life.”
Author: Bob Marley

Quotes: “There's nowhere you can be that isn't where you're meant to be...”
Author: John Lennon

Quotes: “A wonderful fact to reflect upon, that every human creature is constituted to be that profound secret and mystery to every other.”
Author: Charles Dickens,

Quotes: “If you know someone who’s depressed, please resolve never to ask them why. Depression isn’t a straightforward response to a bad situation; depression just is, like the weather.
Author: Stephen Fry

Quotes: “Great heroes need great sorrows and burdens, or half their greatness goes unnoticed. It is all part of the fairy tale.”
Author: Peter S. Beagle,

Quotes: “I am lonely, yet not everybody will do. I don't know why, some people fill the gaps and others emphasize my loneliness. In reality those who satisfy me are those who simply allow me to live with my ''idea of them.”
Author: Anais Nin

Quotes: “I guess that’s just part of loving people: You have to give things up. Sometimes you even have to give them up.”
Author: Lauren Oliver,

Quotes: “Life is too short to waste any amount of time on wondering what other people think about you. In the first place, if they had better things going on in their lives, they wouldn't have the time to sit around and talk about you. What's important to me is not others' opinions of me, but what's important to me is my opinion of myself.”
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quotes: “I don’t trust anybody. Not anybody. And the more that I care about someone, the more sure I am they’re going to get tired of me and take off.”
Author: Rainbow Rowell,

Quotes: “Patience, grasshopper," said Maia. "Good things come to those who wait."
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “The last enemy that shall be destroyed is death.”
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quotes: “You are not entitled to your opinion. You are entitled to your
Author: Harlan Ellison

Quotes: “They say I'm old-fashioned, and live in the past, but sometimes I think progress progresses too fast!”
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quotes: “The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.”
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quotes: “Things need not have happened to be true. Tales and dreams are the shadow-truths that will endure when mere facts are dust and ashes, and forgot.”
Author: Neil Gaiman,

Quotes: “Memories, even your most precious ones, fade surprisingly quickly. But I don’t go along with that. The memories I value most, I don’t ever see them fading.”
Author: Kazuo Ishiguro,

Quotes: “أي علم هذا الذي لم يستطع حتى الآن أن يضع أصوات من نحب في أقراص ، أو زجاجة دواء نتناولها سرًّا ، عندما نصاب بوعكة عاطفية بدون أن يدري صاحبها كم نحن نحتاجه”
Author: أحلام مستغانمي,

Quotes: “My alone feels so good, I'll only have you if you're sweeter than my solitude.”
Author: Warsan Shire

Quotes: “If I had my life to live over again, I would have made a rule to read some poetry and listen to some music at least once every week.”
Author: Charles Darwin,

Quotes: “Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud.”
Author: Maya Angelou,

Quotes: “If everybody is thinking alike, then somebody isn't thinking.”
Author: George S. Patton

Quotes: “Don't give in to your fears. If you do, you won't be able to talk to your heart.”
Author: Paulo Coelho,

Quotes: “Be thankful for everything that happens in your life; it’s all an experience.”
Author: Roy T. Bennett

Quotes: “The voice of the sea speaks to the soul.”
Author: Kate Chopin,

Quotes: “Curiouser and curiouser!”
Author: Lewis Carroll,

Quotes: “Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before.”
Author: Mae West

Quotes: “Why are you worrying about YOU-KNOW-WHO, when you should be worrying about YOU-NO-POO? The constipation sensation that's gripping the nation!”
Author: J.K. Rowling,

Quotes: “I hope you will have a wonderful year, that you'll dream dangerously and outrageously, that you'll make something that didn't exist before you made it, that you will be loved and that you will be liked, and that you will have people to love and to like in return. And, most importantly (because I think there should be more kindness and more wisdom in the world right now), that you will, when you need to be, be wise, and that you will always be kind.”
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quotes: “I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship.”
Author: Louisa May Alcott,

Quotes: “When will you learn that there isn't a word for everything?”
Author: Nicole Krauss,

Quotes: “What is family? They were the people who claimed you. In good, in bad, in parts or in whole, they were the ones who showed up, who stayed in there, regardless. It wasn't just about blood relations or shared chromosomes, but something wider, bigger. We had many families over time. Our family of origin, the family we created, and the groups you moved through while all of this was happening: friends, lovers, sometimes even strangers. None of them perfect, and we couldn't expect them to be. You can't make any one person your world. The trick was to take what each could give you and build your world from it.”
Author: Sarah Dessen,

Quotes: “If I am really a part of your dream, you'll come back one day.”
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quotes: “When we're incomplete, we're always searching for somebody to complete us. When, after a few years or a few months of a relationship, we find that we're still unfulfilled, we blame our partners and take up with somebody more promising. This can go on and on--series polygamy--until we admit that while a partner can add sweet dimensions to our lives, we, each of us, are responsible for our own fulfillment. Nobody else can provide it for us, and to believe otherwise is to delude ourselves dangerously and to program for eventual failure every relationship we enter.”
Author: Tom Robbins

Quotes: “Open a book this minute and start reading. Don’t move until you’ve reached page fifty. Until you’ve buried your thoughts in print. Cover yourself with words. Wash yourself away. Dissolve.”
Author: Carol Shields,

Quotes: “you have to love something before you can hate it.”
Author: Nicholas Sparks,

Quotes: “Either you deal with what is the reality, or you can be sure that the reality is going to deal with you.”
Author: Alex Haley

Quotes: “In my next life I want to live my life backwards. You start out dead and get that out of the way. Then you wake up in an old people's home feeling better every day. You get kicked out for being too healthy, go collect your pension, and then when you start work, you get a gold watch and a party on your first day. You work for 40 years until you're young enough to enjoy your retirement. You party, drink alcohol, and are generally promiscuous, then you are ready for high school. You then go to primary school, you become a kid, you play. You have no responsibilities, you become a baby until you are born. And then you spend your last 9 months floating in luxurious spa-like conditions with central heating and room service on tap, larger quarters every day and then Voila! You finish off as an orgasm!”
Author: Woody Allen

Quotes: “Words dazzle and deceive because they are mimed by the face. But black words on a white page are the soul laid bare.”
Author: Guy de Maupassant

Quotes: “I love you, not just for now, but for always, and I dream of the day that you’ll take me in your arms again.”
Author: Nicholas Sparks,

Quotes: “1. Be Impeccable With Your Word
Author: Don Miguel Ruiz

Quotes: “As a woman I have no country. As a woman I want no country. As a woman, my country is the whole world.”
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: “If the real world were a book, it would never find a publisher. Overlong, detailed to the point of distraction-and ultimately, without a major resolution.”
Author: Jasper Fforde,

Quotes: “No winter lasts forever; no spring skips its turn.”
Author: Hal Borland

Quotes: “The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.”
Author: Edmund Burke

Quotes: “Why do people say "grow some balls"? Balls are weak and sensitive. If you wanna be tough, grow a vagina. Those things can take a pounding.”
Author: Sheng Wang

Quotes: “Shut your eyes and see.”
Author: James Joyce

Quotes: “I could die for you. But I couldn't, and wouldn't, live for you.”
Author: Ayn Rand,

Quotes: “I don't know who invented high heels, but all women owe him a lot!”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quotes: “Education: the path from cocky ignorance to miserable uncertainty.”
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: “When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everyone will respect you.”
Author: Lao Tzu,

Quotes: “Evil is always possible. And goodness is eternally difficult.”
Author: Anne Rice,

Quotes: “Time doesn’t heal emotional pain, you need to learn how to let go.”
Author: Roy T. Bennett,

Quotes: “They say time heals all wounds, but that presumes the source of the grief is finite”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “He awoke each morning with the desire to do right, to be a good and meaningful person, to be, as simple as it sounded and as impossible as it actually was, happy. And during the course of each day his heart would descend from his chest into his stomach. By early afternoon he was overcome by the feeling that nothing was right, or nothing was right for him, and by the desire to be alone. By evening he was fulfilled: alone in the magnitude of his grief, alone in his aimless guilt, alone even in his loneliness.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,

Quotes: “A bit of trash now and then is good for the severest reader. It provides the necessary roughage in the literary diet.”
Author: Phyllis McGinley

Quotes: “I am not proud, but I am happy; and happiness blinds, I think, more than pride.”
Author: Alexandre Dumas,

Quotes: “We sit silently and watch the world around us. This has taken a lifetime to learn. It seems only the old are able to sit next to one another and not say anything and still feel content. The young, brash and impatient, must always break the silence. It is a waste, for silence is pure. Silence is holy. It draws people together because only those who are comfortable with each other can sit without speaking. This is the great paradox.”
Author: Nicholas Sparks,

Quotes: “I hope that in this year to come, you make mistakes.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quotes: “When God Created Mothers"
Author: Erma Bombeck,

Quotes: “Nobody tells this to people who are beginners, I wish someone told me. All of us who do creative work, we get into it because we have good taste. But there is this gap. For the first couple years you make stuff, it’s just not that good. It’s trying to be good, it has potential, but it’s not. But your taste, the thing that got you into the game, is still killer. And your taste is why your work disappoints you. A lot of people never get past this phase, they quit. Most people I know who do interesting, creative work went through years of this. We know our work doesn’t have this special thing that we want it to have. We all go through this. And if you are just starting out or you are still in this phase, you gotta know its normal and the most important thing you can do is do a lot of work. Put yourself on a deadline so that every week you will finish one story. It is only by going through a volume of work that you will close that gap, and your work will be as good as your ambitions. And I took longer to figure out how to do this than anyone I’ve ever met. It’s gonna take awhile. It’s normal to take awhile. You’ve just gotta fight your way through.”
Author: Ira Glass

Quotes: “When you have lost hope, you have lost everything. And when you think all is lost, when all is dire and bleak, there is always hope.”
Author: Pittacus Lore,

Quotes: “We do not need magic to transform our world. We carry all of the power we need inside ourselves already.”
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quotes: “I like it when somebody gets excited about something. It's nice.”
Author: J.D. Salinger,

Quotes: “No sight so sad as that of a naughty child," he began, "especially a naughty little girl. Do you know where the wicked go after death?"
Author: Charlotte Brontë,

Quotes: “I have for the first time found what I can truly love–I have found you. You are my sympathy–my better self–my good angel–I am bound to you with a strong attachment. I think you good, gifted, lovely: a fervent, a solemn passion is conceived in my heart; it leans to you, draws you to my centre and spring of life, wrap my existence about you–and, kindling in pure, powerful flame, fuses you and me in one.”
Author: Charlotte Bronte,

Quotes: “Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.”
Author: Sigmund Freud

Quotes: “Magnus, standing by the door, snapped his fingers impatiently. "Move it along, teenagers. The only person who gets to canoodle in my bedroom is my magnificent self."
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “It's going to be all right, sir," Harry said over and over again, more worried by Dumbledore's silence than he had been by his weakened voice. "We're nearly there ... I can Apparate us both back ... don't worry ..."
Author: J.K. Rowling,

Quotes: “Trains are great dirty smoky things," said Will. "You won't like it."
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “You're the first Shadowhunter I've ever met."
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “I must be a mermaid, Rango. I have no fear of depths and a great fear of shallow living.”
Author: Anais Nin

Quotes: “If you have enough book space, I don't want to talk to you.”
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quotes: “Sometimes I wonder if there's something wrong with me. Perhaps I've spent too long in the company of my literary romantic heroes, and consequently my ideals and expectations are far too high.”
Author: E.L. James,

Quotes: “Let the rain kiss you. Let the rain beat upon your head with silver liquid drops. Let the rain sing you a lullaby.”
Author: Langston Hughes

Quotes: “I'd rather be hated for who I am, than loved for who I am not.”
Author: Kurt Cobain

Quotes: “I was dead until you found me, though I breathed. I was sightless, though I could see. And then you came...and I was awakened.”
Author: J.R. Ward,

Quotes: “There is a crack in everything.
Author: Leonard Cohen,

Quotes: “Everything must be made as simple as possible. But not simpler.”
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: “Alec looked at her and shook his head. "How do you manage never to get mud on your clothes?"
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “You might want to lie down," Magnus advised. "I find that it helps when the crushing sense of horrible realization sets in.”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “The earth has its music for those who will listen”
Author: Reginald Vincent Holmes,

Quotes: “That's the thing about depression: A human being can survive almost anything, as long as she sees the end in sight. But depression is so insidious, and it compounds daily, that it's impossible to ever see the end.”
Author: Elizabeth Wurtzel,

Quotes: “I don't go out with strangers," I said.
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick,

Quotes: “May it be a light to you in dark places, when all other lights go out.”
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,

Quotes: “But I love your feet
Author: Pablo Neruda

Quotes: “The thing that makes you exceptional, if you are at all, is inevitably that which must also make you lonely.”
Author: Lorraine Hansberry

Quotes: “You’re dangerous,” he says.
Author: Simone Elkeles,

Quotes: “When we are young, the words are scattered all around us. As they are assembled by experience, so also are we, sentence by sentence, until the story takes shape.”
Author: Louise Erdrich,

Quotes: “What a blessing it is to love books as I love them;- to be able to converse with the dead, and to live amidst the unreal!”
Author: Thomas Babington Macaulay,

Quotes: “You never change your life until you step out of your comfort zone; change begins at the end of your comfort zone.”
Author: Roy T. Bennett

Quotes: “It's much easier to not know things sometimes. Things change and friends leave. And life doesn't stop for anybody. I wanted to laugh. Or maybe get mad. Or maybe shrug at how strange everybody was, especially me. I think the idea is that every person has to live for his or her own life and than make the choice to share it with other people. You can't just sit their and put everybody's lives ahead of yours and think that counts as love. You just can't. You have to do things. I'm going to do what I want to do. I'm going to be who I really am. And I'm going to figure out what that is. And we could all sit around and wonder and feel bad about each other and blame a lot of people for what they did or didn't do or what they didn't know. I don't know. I guess there could always be someone to blame. It's just different. Maybe it's good to put things in perspective, but sometimes, I think that the only perspective is to really be there. Because it's okay to feel things. I was really there. And that was enough to make me feel infinite. I feel infinite.”
Author: Stephen Chbosky,

Quotes: “I think we ought to read only the kind of books that wound or stab us. If the book we're reading doesn't wake us up with a blow to the head, what are we reading for? So that it will make us happy, as you write? Good Lord, we would be happy precisely if we had no books, and the kind of books that make us happy are the kind we could write ourselves if we had to. But we need books that affect us like a disaster, that grieve us deeply, like the death of someone we loved more than ourselves, like being banished into forests far from everyone, like a suicide. A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us. That is my belief.”
Author: Franz Kafka

Quotes: “The Very first moment I beheld him, my heart was irrevocably gone.”
Author: Jane Austen,

Quotes: “I write to give myself strength. I write to be the characters that I am not. I write to explore all the things I'm afraid of. ”
Author: Joss Whedon

Quotes: “I must learn to be content with being happier than I deserve.”
Author: Jane Austen,

Quotes: “The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.”
Author: Marcel Proust

Quotes: “It's the job that's never started as takes longest to finish.”
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,

Quotes: “The past is always tense, the future perfect.”
Author: Zadie Smith

Quotes: “ Loneliness is the human condition. Cultivate it. The way it tunnels into you allows your soul room to grow. Never expect to outgrow loneliness. Never hope to find people who will understand you, someone to fill that space. An intelligent, sensitive person is the exception, the very great exception. If you expect to find people who will understand you, you will grow murderous with disappointment. The best you'll ever do is to understand yourself, know what it is that you want, and not let the cattle stand in your way.”
Author: Janet Fitch,

Quotes: “I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.”
Author: Nelson Mandela

Quotes: “To put everything in balance is good, to put everything in harmony is better.”
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: “Sometimes you have to lose all you have to find out who you truly are.”
Author: Roy T. Bennett,

Quotes: “Do not let the memories of your past limit the potential of your future. There are no limits to what you can achieve on your journey through life, except in your mind.”
Author: Roy T. Bennett,

Quotes: “To err is human, to forgive, divine.”
Author: Alexander Pope,

Quotes: “Grown-ups don't look like grown-ups on the inside either. Outside, they're big and thoughtless and they always know what they're doing. Inside, they look just like they always have. Like they did when they were your age. Truth is, there aren't any grown-ups. Not one, in the whole wide world.”
Author: Neil Gaiman,

Quotes: “And then something invisible snapped insider her, and that which had come together commenced to fall apart.”
Author: John Green,

Quotes: “If you liked being a teenager, there's something really wrong with you.”
Author: Stephen King

Quotes: “Whenever you feel like criticizing any one...just remember that all the people in this world haven't had the advantages that you've had.”
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quotes: “I'm killing time while I wait for life to shower me with meaning and happiness.”
Author: Bill Watterson

Quotes: “She feels in italics and thinks in CAPITALS.”
Author: Henry James

Quotes: “And I urge you to please notice when you are happy, and exclaim or murmur or think at some point, 'If this isn't nice, I don't know what is.”
Author: Kurt Vonnegut Jr.,

Quotes: “Stop comparing yourself to other people, just choose to be happy and live your own life.”
Author: Roy T. Bennett,

Quotes: “The finest of pleasures are always the unexpected ones.”
Author: Erin Morgenstern,

Quotes: “Second star to the right and straight on 'til morning. ”
Author: J.M. Barrie,

Quotes: “She was the heir of ash and fire, and she would bow to no one.”
Author: Sarah J. Maas,

Quotes: “I think; therefore I am.”
Author: Rene Descartes

Quotes: “You will lose what you value most, so treasure it while you can.”
Author: Richelle Mead,

Quotes: “I hope that one day you will have the experience of doing something you do not understand for someone you love.”
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,

Quotes: “I know it's wrong - God, it's all kinds of wrong - but I just want to lie down with you and wake up with you, just once, just once ever in my life.”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “You should write because you love the shape of stories and sentences and the creation of different words on a page. Writing comes from reading, and reading is the finest teacher of how to write.”
Author: Annie Proulx

Quotes: “Laughter is wine for the soul - laughter soft, or loud and deep, tinged through with seriousness - the hilarious declaration made by man that life is worth living.”
Author: Sean O'Casey

Quotes: “Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.”
Author: Søren Kierkegaard ,

Quotes: “It's hard to enjoy practical jokes when your whole life feels like one.”
Author: Rick Riordan,

Quotes: “You’ll miss the best things if you keep your eyes shut.”
Author: Dr. Seuss,

Quotes: “This is how you do it: you sit down at the keyboard and you put one word after another until its done. It's that easy, and that hard.”
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quotes: “My life has a superb cast, but I cannot figure out the plot.”
Author: Ashleigh Brilliant

Quotes: “Only you can control your future.”
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quotes: “If someone were to harm my family or a friend or somebody I love, I would eat them. I might end up in jail for 500 years, but I would eat them.”
Author: Johnny Depp

Quotes: “Have you ever asked yourself, do monsters make war, or does war make monsters?”
Author: Laini Taylor,

Quotes: “You are not rich until you have a rich heart.”
Author: Roy T. Bennett,

Quotes: “Only a generation of readers will spawn a generation of writers.”
Author: Steven Spielberg

Quotes: “Therefore, dear Sir, love your solitude and try to sing out with the pain it causes you. For those who are near you are far away... and this shows that the space around you is beginning to grow vast.... be happy about your growth, in which of course you can't take anyone with you, and be gentle with those who stay behind; be confident and calm in front of them and don't torment them with your doubts and don't frighten them with your faith or joy, which they wouldn't be able to comprehend. Seek out some simple and true feeling of what you have in common with them, which doesn't necessarily have to alter when you yourself change again and again; when you see them, love life in a form that is not your own and be indulgent toward those who are growing old, who are afraid of the aloneness that you trust.... and don't expect any understanding; but believe in a love that is being stored up for you like an inheritance, and have faith that in this love there is a strength and a blessing so large that you can travel as far as you wish without having to step outside it.”
Author: Rainer Maria Rilke,

Quotes: “So many people walk around with a meaningless life. They seem half-asleep, even when they're busy doing things they think are important. This is because they're chasing the wrong things. The way you get meaning into your life is to devote yourself to loving others, devote yourself to your community around you, and devote yourself to creating something that gives you purpose and meaning.”
Author: Mitch Albom,

Quotes: “The man who passes the sentence should swing the sword. If you would take a man's life, you owe it to him to look into his eyes and hear his final words. And if you cannot bear to do that, then perhaps the man does not deserve to die.”
Author: George R.R. Martin,

Quotes: “To be fully seen by somebody, then, and be loved anyhow - this is a human offering that can border on miraculous.”
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,

Quotes: “Maybe our girlfriends are our soulmates and guys are just people to have fun with.”
Author: Candace Bushnell,

Quotes: “Ignore those that make you fearful and sad, that degrade you back towards disease and death.”
Author: Rumi Jalalud-Din

Quotes: “If you never did you should. These things are fun and fun is good.”
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quotes: “At the end of the day, we can endure much more than we think we can.”
Author: Frida Kahlo

Quotes: “The truth will set you free. But not until it is finished with you.”
Author: David Foster Wallace,

Quotes: “You can only be young once. But you can always be immature.”
Author: Pat  Monahan

Quotes: “Once you have read a book you care about, some part of it is always with you.”
Author: Louis L'Amour,

Quotes: “Sometimes the Bible in the hand of one man is worse than a whisky bottle in the hand of (another)... There are just some kind of men who - who're so busy worrying about the next world they've never learned to live in this one, and you can look down the street and see the results.”
Author: Harper Lee,

Quotes: “All I have seen teaches me to trust the Creator for all I have not seen.”
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quotes: “It is better, I think, to grab at the stars than to sit flustered because you know you cannot reach them.”
Author: R.A. Salvatore,

Quotes: “There are nights when the wolves are silent and only the moon howls. ”
Author: George Carlin

Quotes: “I have nothing to declare except my genius.”
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: “Trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit.”
Author: Moliere

Quotes: “The two hardest tests on the spiritual road are the patience to wait for the right moment and the courage not to be disappointed with what we encounter.”
Author: Paulo Coelho,

Quotes: “In your light I learn how to love. In your beauty, how to make poems. You dance inside my chest where no-one sees you, but sometimes I do, and that sight becomes this art.”
Author: Rumi

Quotes: “Some walks you have to take alone.”
Author: Suzanne Collins,

Quotes: “I wonder how many people don't get the one they want, but end up with the one they're supposed to be with.”
Author: Fannie Flagg,

Quotes: “Nothing behind me, everything ahead of me, as is ever so on the road.”
Author: Jack Kerouac,

Quotes: “When someone is in your heart, they're never truly gone. They can come back to you, even at unlikely times.”
Author: Mitch Albom,

Quotes: “Holding anger is a poison...It eats you from inside...We think that by hating someone we hurt them...But hatred is a curved blade...and the harm we do to others...we also do to ourselves.”
Author: Mitch Albom,

Quotes: “They're certainly entitled to think that, and they're entitled to full respect for their opinions... but before I can live with other folks I've got to live with myself. The one thing that doesn't abide by majority rule is a person's conscience.”
Author: Harper Lee,

Quotes: “All happiness depends on courage and work.”
Author: Honoré de Balzac

Quotes: “The longer I live, the more I observe that carrying around anger is the most debilitating to the person who bears it.”
Author: Katharine Graham

Quotes: “Atticus, he was real nice."
Author: Harper Lee,

Quotes: “Whatever you are physically...male or female, strong or weak, ill or healthy--all those things matter less than what your heart contains. If you have the soul of a warrior, you are a warrior. All those other things, they are the glass that contains the lamp, but
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “If you're texting Magnus to say 'I think u r kewl,' I'm going to kill you."
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “The best way to cheer yourself is to try to cheer someone else up.”
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: “All a girl really wants is for one guy to prove to her that they are not all the same.”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quotes: “You could say sorry," suggested Harry bluntly.
Author: J.K. Rowling,

Quotes: “I'm happy. Which often looks like crazy.”
Author: David Henry Hwang,

Quotes: “Too many of us are hung up on what we don't have, can't have, or won't ever have. We spend too much energy being down, when we could use that same energy – if not less of it – doing, or at least trying to do, some of the things we really want to do.”
Author: Terry McMillan ,

Quotes: “Sometimes love means letting go when you want to hold on tighter.”
Author: Melissa Marr,

Quotes: “Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.”
Author: Marcus Aurelius ,

Quotes: “We shouldn't be looking for heroes, we should be looking for good ideas.”
Author: Noam Chomsky

Quotes: “Heaven knows we need never be ashamed of our tears, for they are rain upon the blinding dust of earth, overlying our hard hearts. I was better after I had cried, than before--more sorry, more aware of my own ingratitude, more gentle.”
Author: Charles Dickens,

Quotes: “All good books are alike in that they are truer than if they had really happened and after you are finished reading one you will feel that all that happened to you and afterwards it all belongs to you: the good and the bad, the ecstasy, the remorse and sorrow, the people and the places and how the weather was. If you can get so that you can give that to people, then you are a writer.”
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: “The major problem—
Author: Douglas Adams,

Quotes: “Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough”
Author: Oprah Winfrey

Quotes: “There is more than one way to burn a book. And the world is full of people running about with lit matches.”
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quotes: “I know how devastated you must be to miss me, but leave a message, and I'll try to ease your agony”
Author: Richelle Mead,

Quotes: “The best way to cheer yourself is to cheer somebody else up.”
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: “There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that receives it.”
Author: Edith Wharton

Quotes: “Don't cry over someone who wouldn't cry over you.”
Author: Lauren Conrad

Quotes: “When the snows fall and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies but the pack survives.”
Author: George R.R. Martin,

Quotes: “Wanting to be someone else is a waste of the person you are.”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quotes: “Can you understand? Someone, somewhere, can you understand me a little, love me a little? For all my despair, for all my ideals, for all that - I love life. But it is hard, and I have so much - so very much to learn.”
Author: Sylvia Plath,

Quotes: “Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood.”
Author: Jane Yolen,

Quotes: “The future depends on what you do today.”
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes: “Dignity
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quotes: “If death meant just leaving the stage long enough to change costume and come back as a new character...Would you slow down? Or speed up?”
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,

Quotes: “Be glad. Be good. Be brave.”
Author: Eleanor Hodgman Porter

Quotes: “Books serve to show a man that those original thoughts of his aren't very new after all.”
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: “If books could have more, give more, be more, show more, they would still need readers who bring to them sound and smell and light and all the rest that can’t be in books.
Author: Gary Paulsen,

Quotes: “I got schooled this year
Author: Colleen Hoover,

Quotes: “The only truth is music.”
Author: Jack Kerouac

Quotes: “Gus: "It tastes like..."
Author: John Green,

Quotes: “The most certain sign of wisdom is cheerfulness. ”
Author: Michel de Montaigne

Quotes: “Your silence will not protect you.”
Author: Audre Lorde,

Quotes: “Talking to a drunk person was like talking to an extremely happy, severely brain-damaged three-year-old.”
Author: John Green,

Quotes: “When I say it's you I like, I'm talking about that part of you that knows that life is far more than anything you can ever see or hear or touch. That deep part of you that allows you to stand for those things without which humankind cannot survive. Love that conquers hate, peace that rises triumphant over war, and justice that proves more powerful than greed.”
Author: Fred Rogers

Quotes: “Parents can only give good advice or put them on the right paths, but the final forming of a person's character lies in their own hands.”
Author: Anne Frank

Quotes: “Freeing yourself was one thing, claiming ownership of that freed self was another.”
Author: Toni Morrison,

Quotes: “make a radical change in your lifestyle and begin to boldly do things which you may previously never have thought of doing, or been too hesitant to attempt. So many people live within unhappy circumstances and yet will not take the initiative to change their situation because they are conditioned to a life of security, conformity, and conservation, all of which may appear to give one peace of mind, but in reality nothing is more damaging to the adventurous spirit within a man than a secure future. The very basic core of a man's living spirit is his passion for adventure. The joy of life comes from our encounters with new experiences, and hence there is no greater joy than to have an endlessly changing horizon, for each day to have a new and different sun. If you want to get more out of life, you must lose your inclination for monotonous security and adopt a helter-skelter style of life that will at first appear to you to be crazy. But once you become accustomed to such a life you will see its full meaning and its incredible beauty.”
Author: Jon Krakauer,

Quotes: “A love like that was a serious illness, an illness from which you never entirely recover.”
Author: Charles Bukowski,

Quotes: “A well-composed book is a magic carpet on which we are wafted to a world that we cannot enter in any other way.”
Author: Caroline Gordon

Quotes: “Life is a mirror: if you frown at it, it frowns back; if you smile, it returns the greeting.”
Author: William Makepeace Thackeray

Quotes: “For to know a man's library is, in some measure, to know his mind.”
Author: Geraldine Brooks,

Quotes: “If you want to get laid, go to college. If you want an education, go to the library.”
Author: Frank Zappa

Quotes: “True love is usually the most inconvenient kind.”
Author: Kiera Cass,

Quotes: “I’m on a roller coaster that only goes up, my friend.”
Author: John Green,

Quotes: “A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it.”
Author: Jean de La Fontaine,

Quotes: “Children begin by loving their parents; as they grow older they judge them; sometimes they forgive them.”
Author: Oscar Wilde,

Quotes: “Reality doesn't impress me. I only believe in intoxication, in ecstasy, and when ordinary life shackles me, I escape, one way or another. No more walls.”
Author: Anaïs Nin,

Quotes: “Nobody gets everything in this life. You decide your priorities and you make your choices. I'd decided long ago that any cake I had would be eaten.”
Author: Donald E. Westlake,

Quotes: “Dreams are always crushing when they don't come true. But it's the simple dreams that are often the most painful because they seem so personal, so reasonable, so attainable. You're always close enough to touch, but never quite close enough to hold and it's enough to break your heart.”
Author: Nicholas Sparks,

Quotes: “The past is never where you think you left it.”
Author: Katherine Anne Porter

Quotes: “I don't mind making jokes, but I don't want to look like one.”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quotes: “Absence diminishes small loves and increases great ones, as the wind blows out the candle and fans the bonfire.”
Author: Francois Duc de la Rochefoucauld,

Quotes: “We're staying together," he promised. "You're not getting away from me. Never again.”
Author: Rick Riordan,

Quotes: “Intelligence plus character-that is the goal of true education.”
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quotes: “Um...is that thing
Author: Rick Riordan,

Quotes: “The earth laughs in flowers.”
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quotes: “In one aspect, yes, I believe in ghosts, but we create them. We haunt ourselves.”
Author: Laurie Halse Anderson,

Quotes: “Books are no more threatened by Kindle than stairs by elevators.”
Author: Stephen Fry

Quotes: “I want you always to remember me. Will you remember that I existed, and that I stood next to you here like this?”
Author: Haruki Murakami,

Quotes: “Have you tried talking to her?"
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “When you read a book, you hold another's mind in your hands.”
Author: James Burke

Quotes: “I am beginning to learn that it is the sweet, simple things of life which are the real ones after all.”
Author: Laura Ingalls Wilder

Quotes: “We do not believe in ourselves until someone reveals that deep inside us something is valuable, worth listening to, worthy of our trust, sacred to our touch. Once we believe in ourselves we can risk curiosity, wonder, spontaneous delight or any experience that reveals the human spirit.”
Author: E.E. Cummings

Quotes: “...you know that a good, long session of weeping can often make you feel better, even if your circumstances have not changed one bit.”
Author: Lemony Snicket,

Quotes: “A mother is the truest friend we have, when trials heavy and sudden fall upon us; when adversity takes the place of prosperity; when friends desert us; when trouble thickens around us, still will she cling to us, and endeavor by her kind precepts and counsels to dissipate the clouds of darkness, and cause peace to return to our hearts.”
Author: Washington Irving

Quotes: “I am too intelligent, too demanding, and too resourceful for anyone to be able to take charge of me entirely. No one knows me or loves me completely. I have only myself”
Author: Simone de Beauvoir

Quotes: “Though my soul may set in darkness, it will rise in perfect light;
Author: Sarah   Williams,

Quotes: “People tend to complicate their own lives, as if living weren't already complicated enough.”
Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,

Quotes: “If you stay, I'll do whatever you want. I'll quit the band, go with you to New York. But if you need me to go away, I'll do that, too. I was talking to Liz and she said maybe coming back to your old life would be too painful, that maybe it'd be easier for you to erase us. And that would suck, but I'd do it. I can lose you like that if I don't lose you today. I'll let you go. If you stay.”
Author: Gayle Forman,

Quotes: “But I didn't understand then. That I could hurt somebody so badly she would never recover. That a person can, just by living, damage another human being beyond repair.”
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quotes: “Have you ever lost someone you love and wanted one more conversation, one more chance to make up for the time when you thought they would be here forever? If so, then you know you can go your whole life collecting days, and none will outweigh the one you wish you had back.”
Author: Mitch Albom,

Quotes: “Adults are always asking little kids what they want to be when they grow up ’cause they’re looking for ideas.”
Author: Paula Poundstone

Quotes: “You deal with mythological stuff for a few years, you learn that paradises are usually places where you get killed.”
Author: Rick Riordan,

Quotes: “I say let the world go to hell, but I should always have my tea.”
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky,

Quotes: “The things you used to own, now they own you.”
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,

Quotes: “A man's face is his autobiography. A woman's face is her work of fiction.”
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: “I’ve been fighting to be who I am all my life. What’s the point of being who I am, if I can’t have the person who was worth all the fighting for?”
Author: Stephanie Lennox,

Quotes: “No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear.”
Author: C.S. Lewis,

Quotes: “Maybe some people are just meant to be in the same story.”
Author: Jandy Nelson,

Quotes: “If, then, I were asked for the most important advice I could give, that which I considered to be the most useful to the men of our century, I should simply say: in the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you.”
Author: Leo Tolstoy,

Quotes: “I guess that's what saying good-bye is always like--like jumping off an edge. The worst part is making the choice to do it. Once you're in the air, there's nothing you can do but let go.”
Author: Lauren Oliver,

Quotes: “ليس هناك كتابا أقرأه و لا أستفيد منه شيئا جديدا ، فحتى الكتاب التافه أستفيد من قراءته ، أني تعلمت شيئا جديدا هو ما هي التفاهة ؟ و كيف يكتب الكتاب التافهون ؟ و فيم يفكرون ؟”
Author: عباس محمود العقاد

Quotes: “That which you believe becomes your world.”
Author: Richard Matheson,

Quotes: “We dream to give ourselves hope. To stop dreaming - well, that’s like saying you can never change your fate.”
Author: Amy Tan,

Quotes: “Our lives are not our own. We are bound to others, past and present, and by each crime and every kindness, we birth our future.”
Author: David Mitchell,

Quotes: “Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love.”
Author: Charles M. Schulz

Quotes: “to love life, to love it even
Author: Ellen Bass

Quotes: “Can you surf really well, then?"
Author: Rick Riordan

Quotes: “We can't be afraid of change. You may feel very secure in the pond that you are in, but if you never venture out of it, you will never know that there is such a thing as an ocean, a sea. Holding onto something that is good for you now, may be the very reason why you don't have something better.”
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quotes: “I want to be in a relationship where you telling me you love me is just a ceremonious validation of what you already show me.”
Author: Steve Maraboli,

Quotes: “Every day is a new day. It is better to be lucky. But I would rather be exact. Then when luck comes you are ready.”
Author: Ernest Hemingway,

Quotes: “there are two types of people in the world: those who prefer to be sad among others, and those who prefer to be sad alone.”
Author: Nicole Krauss,

Quotes: “In the world I am
Author: Bei Dao

Quotes: “To love another person is to see the face of God.”
Author: Victor Hugo,

Quotes: “Some things in life are out of your control. You can make it a party or a tragedy.”
Author: Nora Roberts,

Quotes: “Even
Author: Hafiz

Quotes: “You only live twice:
Author: Ian Fleming,

Quotes: “Sex is part of nature. I go along with nature.”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quotes: “With enough courage, you can do without a reputation.”
Author: Margaret Mitchell

Quotes: “It is a far, far better thing that I do, than I have ever done; it is a far, far better rest that I go to than I have ever known.”
Author: Charles Dickens,

Quotes: “I want everyone to meet you. You're my favorite person of all time.”
Author: Rainbow Rowell,

Quotes: “Imagination is like a muscle. I found out that the more I wrote, the bigger it got.”
Author: Philip José Farmer

Quotes: “I feel like someone breathed new air into my lungs. I am not Abnegation. I am not Dauntless.
Author: Veronica Roth,

Quotes: “The most effective way to destroy people is to deny and obliterate their own understanding of their history.”
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: “Incredible change happens in your life when you decide to take control of what you do have power over instead of craving control over what you don't.”
Author: Steve Maraboli,

Quotes: “There are moments when troubles enter our lives and we can do nothing to avoid them.
Author: Paulo Coelho,

Quotes: “I can only note that the past is beautiful because one never realises an emotion at the time. It expands later, and thus we don't have complete emotions about the present, only about the past.”
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: “Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.”
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: “If there's one thing I've learned, it's this: We all want everything to be okay. We don't even wish so much for fantastic or marvelous or outstanding. We will happily settle for okay, because most of the time, okay is enough.”
Author: David Levithan,

Quotes: “If you have the words, there's always a chance that you'll find the way.”
Author: Seamus Heaney,

Quotes: “Educating the mind without educating the heart is no education at all.”
Author: Aristotle

Quotes: “To-morrow, and to-morrow, and to-morrow,
Author: William Shakespeare,

Quotes: “There are three questions every woman should be able to answer yes to before they commit to a man. If you answer no to any of the three questions, run like hell."
Author: Colleen Hoover,

Quotes: “What's up?" I asked.
Author: Richelle Mead,

Quotes: “He died not for men, but for each man. If each man had been the only man made, He would have done no less.”
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quotes: “The unfed mind devours itself.”
Author: Gore Vidal

Quotes: “I bet you could sometimes find all the mysteries of the universe in someone's hand.”
Author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz,

Quotes: “So light a fire!" Harry choked. "Yes...of course...but there's no wood!" ...
Author: J.K. Rowling,

Quotes: “We are each our own devil, and we make this world our hell.”
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: “Being with you never felt wrong. It's the one thing I did right. You're the one thing I did right.”
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick,

Quotes: “Well, she's not responding to my advances," he observed more brightly than he felt, "so she must be dead."
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “You alone are enough. You have nothing to prove to anybody.”
Author: Maya Angelou

Quotes: “Blessed are the hearts that can bend; they shall never be broken.”
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: “Anybody can sympathise with the sufferings of a friend, but it requires a very fine nature to sympathise with a friend's success.”
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: “Name the greatest of all inventors. Accident.”
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: “Children learn more from what you are than what you teach.”
Author: W.E.B. DuBois

Quotes: “To die, it's easy. But you have to struggle for life.”
Author: Art Spiegelman,

Quotes: “When you trip over love, it is easy to get up. But when you fall in love, it is impossible to stand again.”
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: “Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart”
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quotes: “Hope is a waking dream.”
Author: Aristotle

Quotes: “You are okay?" he asked. "Not eaten by monsters?"
Author: Rick Riordan,

Quotes: “You cannot pick and choose what parts of her to love.”
Author: Sarah J. Maas,

Quotes: “I decided it is better to scream. Silence is the real crime against humanity.”
Author: Nadezhda Mandelstam,

Quotes: “Will rolled up his sleeves. "We'll probably have to knock down the door--"
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “A man is but the product of his thoughts. What he thinks, he becomes.”
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes: “You care so much you feel as though you will bleed to death with the pain of it.”
Author: J.K. Rowling,

Quotes: “Only people who are capable of loving strongly can also suffer great sorrow, but this same necessity of loving serves to counteract their grief and heals them.”
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quotes: “The power of a glance has been so much abused in love stories, that it has come to be disbelieved in. Few people dare now to say that two beings have fallen in love because they have looked at each other. Yet it is in this way that love begins, and in this way only.”
Author: Victor Hugo,

Quotes: “The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men.”
Author: Plato

Quotes: “All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.”
Author: Walt Disney

Quotes: “I'm always happy," Sasha said. "Sometimes I just forget.”
Author: Jennifer Egan,

Quotes: “One day you will ask me which is more important? My life or yours? I will say mine and you will walk away not knowing that you are my life.”
Author: Khalil Gibran

Quotes: “Man only likes to count his troubles; he doesn't calculate his happiness.”
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky,

Quotes: “A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.”
Author: Charles Darwin,

Quotes: “The question is not what you look at, but what you see.”
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quotes: “My name is Celaena Sardothien. But it makes no difference if my name's Celaena or Lillian or Bitch, because I'd still beat you, no matter what you call me.”
Author: Sarah J. Maas,

Quotes: “How do I love thee? Let me count the ways.
Author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

Quotes: “Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.”
Author: Helen Keller,

Quotes: “Most men would rather deny a hard truth than face it.”
Author: George R.R. Martin,

Quotes: “I suffer from girlnextdooritis where the guy is friends with you and that's it.”
Author: Taylor Swift

Quotes: “I think there should be a rule that everyone in the world should get a standing ovation at least once in their lives.”
Author: R.J. Palacio,

Quotes: “What is straight? A line can be straight, or a street, but the human heart, oh, no, it's curved like a road through mountains.”
Author: Tennessee Williams,

Quotes: “The homemaker has the ultimate career. All other careers exist for one purpose only - and that is to support the ultimate career. ”
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quotes: “Of course motivation is not permanent. But then, neither is bathing; but it is something you should do on a regular basis.”
Author: Zig Ziglar,

Quotes: “Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.”
Author: J.K.Rowling,

Quotes: “A person who has good thoughts cannot ever be ugly. You can have a wonky nose and a crooked mouth and a double chin and stick-out teeth, but if you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely.”
Author: Roald Dahl,

Quotes: “Freedom lies in being bold.”
Author: Robert Frost

Quotes: “I believe in God, but not as one thing, not as an old man in the sky. I believe that what people call God is something in all of us. I believe that what Jesus and Mohammed and Buddha and all the rest said was right. It's just that the translations have gone wrong.”
Author: John Lennon

Quotes: “History does not always repeat itself. Sometimes it just yells, 'Can't you remember anything I told you?' and lets fly with a club.”
Author: John W. Campbell Jr.

Quotes: “Words were different when they lived inside of you.”
Author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz,

Quotes: “Demon pox, oh demon pox
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “Men go to far greater lengths to avoid what they fear than to obtain what they desire.”
Author: Dan Brown,

Quotes: “Women want love to be a novel. Men, a short story.”
Author: Daphne du Maurier

Quotes: “Words, I think, are such unpredictable creatures.
Author: Tahereh Mafi,

Quotes: “The impossible could not have happened, therefore the impossible must be possible in spite of appearances.”
Author: Agatha Christie,

Quotes: “Great minds discuss ideas. Average minds discuss events. Small minds discuss people.”
Author: Henry Thomas Buckle

Quotes: “Good sex is like good bridge. If you don't have a good partner, you'd better have a good hand.”
Author: Mae West

Quotes: “Those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.”
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: “Seventeen, eh!" said Hagrid as he accepted a bucket-sized glass of wine from Fred.
Author: J.K. Rowling,

Quotes: “The more clearly we can focus our attention on the wonders and realities of the universe about us, the less taste we shall have for destruction.”
Author: Rachel Carson

Quotes: “Nothing travels faster than the speed of light, with the possible exception of bad news, which obeys its own special laws.”
Author: Douglas Adams,

Quotes: “Do you think that I count the days? There is only one day left, always starting over: it is given to us at dawn and taken away from us at dusk.”
Author: Jean-Paul Sartre

Quotes: “The mark of the immature man is that he wants to die nobly for a cause, while the mark of the mature man is that he wants to live humbly for one.”
Author: J.D. Salinger,

Quotes: “You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.”
Author: Jack London
