Quotes: “But I believe in true love, you know? I don't believe that everybody gets to keep their eyes or not get sick or whatever, but everybody should have true love, and it should last at least as long as your life does.”
Author: John Green,

Quotes: “Love is like a tree: it grows by itself, roots itself deeply in our being and continues to flourish over a heart in ruin. The inexplicable fact is that the blinder it is, the more tenacious it is. It is never stronger than when it is completely unreasonable.”
Author: Victor Hugo,

Quotes: “She looked at nice young men as if she could smell their stupidity.”
Author: Flannery O'Connor

Quotes: “Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheard, are sweeter”
Author: John Keats,

Quotes: “Always be a poet, even in prose.”
Author: Charles Baudelaire

Quotes: “You never know what life is like, until you have lived it.”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quotes: “What's terrible is to pretend that second-rate is first-rate. To pretend that you don't need love when you do; or you like your work when you know quite well you're capable of better.”
Author: Doris Lessing,

Quotes: “What is right is not always popular and what is popular is not always right.”
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: “We dream in our waking moments, and walk in our sleep.”
Author: Nathaniel Hawthorne,

Quotes: “Oh, we're playing nice now? Shall we have tea first? Brew up a nice pot of kiss-my-ass?”
Author: Julie Kagawa,

Quotes: “Life is like a prism. What you see depends on how you turn the glass.”
Author: Jonathan Kellerman

Quotes: “Why do beautiful songs make you sad?' 'Because they aren't true.' 'Never?' 'Nothing is beautiful and true.”
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,

Quotes: “He was the crazy one who had painted himself black and defeated the world.
Author: Markus Zusak,

Quotes: “Without you in my arms, I feel an emptiness in my soul. I find myself searching the crowds for your face - I know it's an impossibility, but I cannot help myself.”
Author: Nicholas Sparks,

Quotes: “Stop fighting me!" he said, trying to pull on the arm he held.
Author: Richelle Mead,

Quotes: “You believe in a book that has talking animals, wizards, witches, demons, sticks turning into snakes, burning bushes, food falling from the sky, people walking on water, and all sorts of magical, absurd and primitive stories, and you say that we are the ones that need help?”
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: “Sometimes, the best way to help someone is just to be near them.”
Author: Veronica Roth,

Quotes: “I guess by now I should know enough about loss to realize that you never really stop missing someone-you just learn to live around the huge gaping hole of their absence.”
Author: Alyson Noel,

Quotes: “Never miss a good chance to shut up.”
Author: Will Rogers

Quotes: “This is a new year. A new beginning. And things will change.”
Author: Taylor Swift

Quotes: “Usually we walk around constantly believing ourselves. "I'm okay" we say. "I'm alright". But sometimes the truth arrives on you and you can't get it off. That's when you realize that sometimes it isn't even an answer--it's a question. Even now, I wonder how much of my life is convinced.”
Author: Markus Zusak,

Quotes: “Let the improvement of yourself keep you so busy that you have no time to criticize others.”
Author: Roy T. Bennett,

Quotes: “I can't eat and I can't sleep. I'm not doing well in terms of being a functional human, you know?”
Author: Ned Vizzini,

Quotes: “There will be a few times in your life when all your instincts will tell you to do something, something that defies logic, upsets your plans, and may seem crazy to others. When that happens, you do it. Listen to your instincts and ignore everything else. Ignore logic, ignore the odds, ignore the complications, and just go for it.”
Author: Judith McNaught,

Quotes: “A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on. ”
Author: William S. Burroughs

Quotes: “Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll land among the stars.”
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quotes: “This is where it all begins. Everything starts here, today.”
Author: David Nicholls,

Quotes: “Happiness is something that comes into our lives through doors we don't even remember leaving open.”
Author: Rose Wilder Lane

Quotes: “When you go into the ER, one of the first things they ask you to do is rate your pain on a scale of one to ten, and from there they decide which drugs to use and how quickly to use them. I'd been asked this question hundreds of times over the years, and I remember once early on when I couldn't get my breath and it felt like my chest was on fire, flames licking the inside of my ribs fighting for a way to burn out of my body, my parents took me to the ER. nurse asked me about the pain, and I couldn't even speak, so I held up nine fingers.
Author: John Green,

Quotes: “Watch out for intellect,
Author: Anne Sexton,

Quotes: “My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She's ninety-seven now, and we don't know where the heck she is.”
Author: Ellen DeGeneres

Quotes: “Sometimes you lose a battle. But mischief always wins the war”
Author: John Green,

Quotes: “District 12: Where you can starve to death in safety.”
Author: Suzanne Collins,

Quotes: “I am both happy and sad at the same time, and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be.”
Author: Stephen Chbosky,

Quotes: “He felt that his whole life was some kind of dream and he sometimes wondered whose it was and whether they were enjoying it.”
Author: Douglas Adams,

Quotes: “To do the useful thing, to say the courageous thing, to contemplate the beautiful thing: that is enough for one man's life.”
Author: T.S. Eliot,

Quotes: “What draws people to be friends is that they see the same truth. They share it.”
Author: C. S. Lewis

Quotes: “It's only those who do nothing that make no mistakes, I suppose.”
Author: Joseph Conrad,

Quotes: “You’ll get over it…” It’s the clichés that cause the trouble. To lose someone you love is to alter your life for ever. You don’t get over it because ‘it” is the person you loved. The pain stops, there are new people, but the gap never closes. How could it? The particularness of someone who mattered enough to grieve over is not made anodyne by death. This hole in my heart is in the shape of you and no-one else can fit it. Why would I want them to?”
Author: Jeanette Winterson,

Quotes: “Now that she had nothing to lose, she was free.”
Author: Paulo Coelho,

Quotes: “Luxury is not a necessity to me, but beautiful and good things are.”
Author: Anais Nin

Quotes: “A small but noteworthy note. I've seen so many young men over the years who think they're running at other young men. They are not. They are running at me.”
Author: Markus Zusak,

Quotes: “Damn, Claire. Warn a guy before you do a face-plant on the floor next time. I could have looked all heroic and caught you or something -Shane”
Author: Rachel Caine,

Quotes: “If you let people into your life a little bit, they can be pretty damn amazing.”
Author: Sherman Alexie,

Quotes: “There are perhaps many causes worth dying for, but to me, certainly, there are none worth killing for.”
Author: Albert Dietrich,

Quotes: “I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception.”
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: “You have everything needed for the extravagant journey that is your life.”
Author: Carlos Castaneda

Quotes: “لا تجالس أنصاف العشاق، ولا تصادق أنصاف الأصدقاء، لا تقرأ لأنصاف الموهوبين،لا تعش نصف حياة، ولا تمت نصف موت،لا تختر نصف حل، ولا تقف في منتصف الحقيقة، لا تحلم نصف حلم، ولا تتعلق بنصف أمل، إذا صمتّ.. فاصمت حتى النهاية، وإذا تكلمت.. فتكلّم حتى النهاية، لا تصمت كي تتكلم، ولا تتكلم كي تصمت.
Author: جبران خليل جبران

Quotes: “The good thing about science is that it's true whether or not you believe in it.”
Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

Quotes: “I decided as long as I'm going to hell, I might as well do it thoroughly.”
Author: Stephenie Meyer,

Quotes: “You're something between a dream and a miracle.”
Author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

Quotes: “Atticus said to Jem one day, "I’d rather you shot at tin cans in the backyard, but I know you’ll go after birds. Shoot all the blue jays you want, if you can hit ‘em, but remember it’s a sin to kill a mockingbird." That was the only time I ever heard Atticus say it was a sin to do something, and I asked Miss Maudie about it. "Your father’s right," she said. "Mockingbirds don’t do one thing except make music for us to enjoy. They don’t eat up people’s gardens, don’t nest in corn cribs, they don’t do one thing but sing their hearts out for us. That’s why it’s a sin to kill a mockingbird.”
Author: Harper Lee,

Quotes: “When one is in love, one always begins by deceiving one's self, and one always ends by deceiving others. That is what the world calls a romance.”
Author: Oscar Wilde,

Quotes: “Whoever is careless with the truth in small matters cannot be trusted with important matters”
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: “We don’t need a list of rights and wrongs, tables of dos and don’ts: we need books, time, and silence.
Author: Philip Pullman

Quotes: “Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise.”
Author: Margaret Atwood,

Quotes: “I'm going to keep going until I succeed — or die. Don't think I don't know how this might end. I've known it for years.”
Author: J.K. Rowling,

Quotes: “We need not to be let alone. We need to be really bothered once in a while. How long is it since you were really bothered? About something important, about something real?”
Author: Ray Bradbury,

Quotes: “The mind I love must have wild places.”
Author: Katherine Mansfield

Quotes: “If the moon smiled, she would resemble you.
Author: Sylvia Plath,

Quotes: “Alone. Yes, that's the key word, the most awful word in the English tongue. Murder doesn't hold a candle to it and hell is only a poor synonym.”
Author: Stephen King

Quotes: “Well-read people are less likely to be evil.”
Author: Lemony Snicket,

Quotes: “May your trails be crooked, winding, lonesome, dangerous, leading to the most amazing view.”
Author: Edward Abbey

Quotes: “To survive, you must tell stories.”
Author: Umberto Eco,

Quotes: “Don't let the muggles get you down.”
Author: J.K. Rowling,

Quotes: “Nothing on earth can make up for the loss of one who has loved you.”
Author: Selma Lagerlöf

Quotes: “You think because he doesn't love you that you are worthless. You think that because he doesn't want you anymore that he is right -- that his judgement and opinion of you are correct. If he throws you out, then you are garbage. You think he belongs to you because you want to belong to him. Don't. It's a bad word, 'belong.' Especially when you put it with somebody you love. Love shouldn't be like that. Did you ever see the way the clouds love a mountain? They circle all around it; sometimes you can't even see the mountain for the clouds. But you know what? You go up top and what do you see? His head. The clouds never cover the head. His head pokes through, beacuse the clouds let him; they don't wrap him up. They let him keep his head up high, free, with nothing to hide him or bind him. You can't own a human being. You can't lose what you don't own. Suppose you did own him. Could you really love somebody who was absolutely nobody without you? You really want somebody like that? Somebody who falls apart when you walk out the door? You don't, do you? And neither does he. You're turning over your whole life to him. Your whole life, girl. And if it means so little to you that you can just give it away, hand it to him, then why should it mean any more to him? He can't value you more than you value yourself.”
Author: Toni Morrison

Quotes: “Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else.”
Author: Judy Garland

Quotes: “It is easy to forget how full the world is of people, full to bursting, and each of them imaginable and consistently misimagined.”
Author: John Green,

Quotes: “I know some who are constantly drunk on books as other men are drunk on whiskey.”
Author: H.L. Mencken

Quotes: “To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer.”
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes: “No mourners. No funerals. Among them, it passed for 'good luck.”
Author: Leigh Bardugo,

Quotes: “I'm afraid that sometimes you'll play lonely games too. Games you can't win 'cause you'll play against you.”
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quotes: “Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.”
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: “Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not; remember that what you now have was once among the things you only hoped for.”
Author: Epicurus

Quotes: “Do not set aside your happiness. Do not wait to be happy in the future. The best time to be happy is always now.”
Author: Roy T. Bennett

Quotes: “Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier. Be the living expression of God's kindness: kindness in your face, kindness in your eyes, kindness in your smile.”
Author: Mother Teresa

Quotes: “One must dare to be happy. ”
Author: Gertrude Stein

Quotes: “The things we love destroy us every time, lad. Remember that.”
Author: George R.R. Martin,

Quotes: “Did you really want to die?"
Author: Tiffanie DeBartolo,

Quotes: “Every weirdo in the world is on my wavelength.”
Author: Thomas Pynchon

Quotes: “Stories you read when you're the right age never quite leave you. You may forget who wrote them or what the story was called. Sometimes you'll forget precisely what happened, but if a story touches you it will stay with you, haunting the places in your mind that you rarely ever visit.”
Author: Neil Gaiman,

Quotes: “I’m not in this world to live up to your expectations and you’re not in this world to live up to mine.”
Author: Bruce Lee

Quotes: “I may not have been sure about what really did interest me, but I was absolutely sure about what didn't.”
Author: Albert Camus,

Quotes: “God, but life is loneliness, despite all the opiates, despite the shrill tinsel gaiety of "parties" with no purpose, despite the false grinning faces we all wear. And when at last you find someone to whom you feel you can pour out your soul, you stop in shock at the words you utter - they are so rusty, so ugly, so meaningless and feeble from being kept in the small cramped dark inside you so long. Yes, there is joy, fulfillment and companionship - but the loneliness of the soul in its appalling self-consciousness is horrible and overpowering.”
Author: Sylvia Plath,

Quotes: “In my younger and more vulnerable years my father gave me some advice that I've been turning over in my mind ever since.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,

Quotes: “Holding people away from you, and denying yourself love, that doesn't make you strong. if anything, it makes you weaker. Because you're doing it out of fear.”
Author: Sarah Dessen,

Quotes: “Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.”
Author: Walt Whitman

Quotes: “No good deed goes unpunished.”
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: “If no one cares for you at all, do you even really exist?”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “A girl calls and asks, "Does it hurt very much to die?"
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,

Quotes: “Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place.”
Author: Zora Neale Hurston

Quotes: “I hate men who are afraid of women's strength.”
Author: Anaïs Nin,

Quotes: “However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?”
Author: Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

Quotes: “Look at everything always as though you were seeing it either for the first or last time: Thus is your time on earth filled with glory.”
Author: Betty Smith,

Quotes: “There are much worse games to play.”
Author: Suzanne Collins,

Quotes: “Reading is like thinking, like praying, like talking to a friend, like expressing your ideas, like listening to other people's ideas, like listening to music, like looking at the view, like taking a walk on the beach.”
Author: Roberto Bolaño,

Quotes: “When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion.”
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: “I feel free and strong. If I were not a reader of books I could not feel this way.”
Author: Walter Tevis

Quotes: “When things break, it's not the actual breaking that prevents them from getting back together again. It's because a little piece gets lost - the two remaining ends couldn't fit together even if they wanted to. The whole shape has changed.”
Author: John Green,

Quotes: “A short story is a different thing altogether – a short story is like a quick kiss in the dark from a stranger.”
Author: Stephen King,

Quotes: “Learn the rules, break the rules, make up new rules, break the new rules.”
Author: Marvin Bell

Quotes: “I like people too much or not at all. I've got to go down deep, to fall into people, to really know them.”
Author: Sylvia Plath,

Quotes: “The most terrible poverty is loneliness, and the feeling of being unloved.”
Author: Mother Teresa

Quotes: “Behind this mask there is more than just flesh. Beneath this mask there is an idea... and ideas are bulletproof.”
Author: Alan Moore,

Quotes: “And then I felt sad because I realized that once people are broken in certain ways, they can't ever be fixed, and this is something nobody ever tells you when you are young and it never fails to surprise you as you grow older as you see the people in your life break one by one. You wonder when your turn is going to be, or if it's already happened.”
Author: Douglas Coupland,

Quotes: “Humor is reason gone mad.”
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: “I restore myself when I'm alone.”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quotes: “You get what anybody gets - you get a lifetime.”
Author: Neil Gaiman,

Quotes: “We are always the same age inside. ”
Author: Gertrude Stein

Quotes: “When I'm good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better. ”
Author: Mae West

Quotes: “there is a place in the heart that
Author: Charles bukowski

Quotes: “We are all born sexual creatures,thank God, but it's a pity so many people despise and crush this natural gift.”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quotes: “The best way out is always through.”
Author: Robert Frost

Quotes: “I am going to take this bucket of water and pour it on the flames of hell, and then I am going to use this torch to burn down the gates of paradise so that people will not love God for want of heaven or fear of hell, but because He is God.”
Author: John Green,

Quotes: “The sunlight claps the earth, and the moonbeams kiss the sea: what are all these kissings worth, if thou kiss not me?”
Author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

Quotes: “Courage isn't having the strength to go on - it is going on when you don't have strength.”
Author: Napoleon Bonaparte

Quotes: “Being the richest man in the cemetery doesn't matter to me. Going to bed at night saying we've done something wonderful... that's what matters to me.”
Author: Steve Jobs

Quotes: “To lose balance sometimes for love is part of living a balanced
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,

Quotes: “The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated.”
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes: “There's a bluebird in my heart that wants to get out
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quotes: “Can you be a girl for a few seconds?"
Author: Veronica Roth,

Quotes: “The mountains are calling and I must go.”
Author: John Muir

Quotes: “Never leave a friend behind. Friends are all we have to get us through this life--and they are the only things from this world that we could hope to see in the next.”
Author: Dean Koontz,

Quotes: “The best way to not feel hopeless is to get up and do something. Don’t wait for good things to happen to you. If you go out and make some good things happen, you will fill the world with hope, you will fill yourself with hope.”
Author: Barack Obama

Quotes: “All thinking men are atheists.”
Author: Ernest Hemingway,

Quotes: “I don't suffer from my insanity -- I enjoy every minute of it.”
Author: Sherrilyn Kenyon,

Quotes: “Feminism is the radical notion that women are human beings.”
Author: Cheris Kramarae

Quotes: “You're a guardian angel now." I was still too much in awe to wrap my mind around it, but at the same time I felt amazement, curiosity...happiness.
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick,

Quotes: “Hang on, did you just call me Angel?" I asked.
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick,

Quotes: “The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.”
Author: Sun Tzu,

Quotes: “I just want to be wonderful.”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quotes: “It would seem that Our Lord finds our desires not too strong, but too weak. We are half-hearted creatures, fooling about with drink and sex and ambition when infinite joy is offered us, like an ignorant child who wants to go on making mud pies in a slum because he cannot imagine what is meant by the offer of a holiday at the sea. We are far too easily pleased.”
Author: C.S. Lewis,

Quotes: “Passion makes a person stop eating, sleeping, working, feeling at peace. A lot of people are frightened because, when it appears, it demolishes all the old things it finds in its path.
Author: Paulo Coelho,

Quotes: “If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can ever warm me, I know that is poetry.”
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quotes: “Death is so terribly final, while life is full of possibilities.”
Author: George R.R. Martin,

Quotes: “But until a person can say deeply and honestly, "I am what I am today because of the choices I made yesterday," that person cannot say, "I choose otherwise.”
Author: Stephen R. Covey,

Quotes: “Ignorance killed the cat; curiosity was framed!”
Author: C. J. Cherryh

Quotes: “You forget what you want to remember, and you remember what you want to forget.”
Author: Cormac McCarthy,

Quotes: “After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations.”
Author: Oscar Wilde,

Quotes: “She was a genius of sadness, immersing herself in it, separating its numerous strands, appreciating its subtle nuances. She was a prism through which sadness could be divided into its infinite spectrum.”
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,

Quotes: “The advantage of a bad memory is that one enjoys several times the same good things for the first time.”
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: “My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness.”
Author: Dalai Lama XIV

Quotes: “I sit beside the fire and think
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien

Quotes: “I think and think and think, I‘ve thought myself out of happiness one million times, but never once into it.”
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer

Quotes: “I find out a lot about myself by sleeping. Dreams, they are who I am when I’m too tired to be me.”
Author: Jarod Kintz,

Quotes: “Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.”
Author: Marie Curie

Quotes: “Ask for what you want and be prepared to get it!”
Author: Maya Angelou

Quotes: “If you are a student you should always get a good nights sleep unless you have come to the good part of your book, and then you should stay up all night and let your schoolwork fall by the wayside, a phrase which means 'flunk'.”
Author: Lemony Snicket

Quotes: “Man often becomes what he believes himself to be. If I keep on saying to myself that I cannot do a certain thing, it is possible that I may end by really becoming incapable of doing it. On the contrary, if I have the belief that I can do it, I shall surely acquire the capacity to do it even if I may not have it at the beginning.”
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes: “There is no such thing as a "broken family." Family is family, and is not determined by marriage certificates, divorce papers, and adoption documents. Families are made in the heart. The only time family becomes null is when those ties in the heart are cut. If you cut those ties, those people are not your family. If you make those ties, those people are your family. And if you hate those ties, those people will still be your family because whatever you hate will always be with you.”
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quotes: “If Peeta and I were both to die, or they thought we were....My fingers fumble with the pouch on my belt, freeing it. Peeta sees it and his hand clamps on my wrist. "No, I won't let you." "Trust me," I whisper. He holds my gaze for a long moment then lets go. I loosen the top of the pouch and pour a few spoonfuls of berries into his palm. Then I fill my own. "On the count of three?" Peeta leans down and kisses me once, very gently. "The count of three," he says. We stand, our backs pressed together, our empty hands locked tight. "Hold them out. I want everyone to see," he says. I spread out my fingers, and the dark berries glisten in the sun. I give Peeta's hand one last squeeze as a signal, as a good-bye, and we begin counting. "One." Maybe I'm wrong. "Two." Maybe they don't care if we both die. "Three!" It's too late to change my mind. I lift my hand to my mouth taking one last look at the world. The berries have just passed my lips when the trumpets begin to blare. The frantic voice of Claudius Templesmith shouts above them. "Stop! Stop! Ladies and gentlemen, I am pleased to present the victors of the 74th Hunger Games, Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark! I give you - the tributes of District 12!”
Author: Suzanne Collins,

Quotes: “I live for coincidences. They briefly give to me the illusion or the hope that there's a pattern to my life, and if there's a pattern, then maybe I'm moving toward some kind of destiny where it's all explained.”
Author: Jonathan Ames,

Quotes: “Maybe this world is another planet’s hell.”
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quotes: “We are surrounded by story.”
Author: Alice McDermott

Quotes: “Moths," repeats Will. "You're afraid of moths?"
Author: Veronica Roth,

Quotes: “Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television.”
Author: Woody Allen

Quotes: “Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not. ”
Author: Pablo Picasso,

Quotes: “I was always hungry for love. Just once, I wanted to know what it was like to get my fill of it -- to be fed so much love I couldn't take any more. Just once. ”
Author: Haruki Murakami,

Quotes: “It crosses my mind that Cinna's calm and normal demeanor masks a complete madman.”
Author: Suzanne Collins,

Quotes: “Never attempt to teach a pig to sing; it wastes your time and annoys the pig.”
Author: Robert Heinlein,

Quotes: “The truth is what I make it. I could set this world on fire and call it rain.”
Author: Victoria Aveyard,

Quotes: “God alert!" Blackjack yelled. "It's the wine dude!
Author: Rick Riordan,

Quotes: “The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.”
Author: Ben Okri

Quotes: “Freedom (n.): To ask nothing. To expect nothing. To depend on nothing.”
Author: Ayn Rand,

Quotes: “We need to talk. All of us About what we're going to do now."
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “It isn't what we say or think that defines us, but what we do.”
Author: Jane Austen,

Quotes: “I fell in love with you, smartass, because you were one of us—because you weren’t afraid of me, and you decided to end your spectacular victory by throwing that piece of bone at Amarantha like a javelin. I felt Cassian’s spirit beside me in that moment, and could have sworn I heard him say, ‘If you don’t marry her, you stupid prick, I will.”
Author: Sarah J. Maas,

Quotes: “The course of true love never did run smooth.”
Author: William Shakespeare,

Quotes: “He allowed himself to be swayed by his conviction that human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but that life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves.”
Author: Gabriel García Márquez,

Quotes: “I figured all your classes were stuff like Slaughter 101 and Beheading for Beginners."
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along.”
Author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

Quotes: “Five exclamation marks, the sure sign of an insane mind.”
Author: Terry Pratchett,

Quotes: “The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing. ”
Author: Walt Disney

Quotes: “It is not the length of life, but the depth.”
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quotes: “Being a nerd, which is to say going too far and caring too much about a subject, is the best way to make friends I know.”
Author: Sarah Vowell,

Quotes: “Whenever you think or you believe or you know, you're a lot of other people: but the moment you feel, you're nobody-but-yourself.”
Author: e.e. cummings

Quotes: “The desire to reach for the stars is ambitious. The desire to reach hearts is wise.”
Author: Maya Angelou

Quotes: “He who knows all the answers has not been asked all the questions.”
Author: Confucius

Quotes: “So we shall let the reader answer this question for himself: who is the happier man, he who has braved the storm of life and lived or he who has stayed securely on shore and merely existed?”
Author: Hunter S. Thompson

Quotes: “If I am not good to myself, how can I expect anyone else to be good to me?”
Author: Maya Angelou

Quotes: “الحداد ليس في ما نرتديه بل في ما نراه . إنّه يكمن في نظرتنا
Author: أحلام مستغانمي,

Quotes: “It is very risky. But each time a child opens a book, he pushes open the gate that separates him from Elsewhere.”
Author: Lois Lowry

Quotes: “We'd get sick on too many cookies, but ever so much sicker on no cookies at all.”
Author: Sinclair Lewis

Quotes: “Autumn is a second spring when every leaf is a flower.”
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: “I have accepted fear as part of life – specifically the fear of change... I have gone ahead despite the pounding in the heart that says: turn back....”
Author: Erica Jong

Quotes: “The surest way to corrupt a youth is to instruct him to hold in higher esteem those who think alike than those who think differently.”
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: “The role of a writer is not to say what we can all say, but what we are unable to say.”
Author: Anais Nin

Quotes: “Man, when you lose your laugh you lose your footing.”
Author: Ken Kesey,

Quotes: “If I should have a daughter…“Instead of “Mom”, she’s gonna call me “Point B.” Because that way, she knows that no matter what happens, at least she can always find her way to me. And I’m going to paint the solar system on the back of her hands so that she has to learn the entire universe before she can say “Oh, I know that like the back of my hand.”
Author: Sarah Kay

Quotes: “This is how it works. I love the people in my life, and I do for my friends whatever they need me to do for them, again and again, as many times as is necessary. For example, in your case you always forgot who you are and how much you're loved. So what I do for you as your friend is remind you who you are and tell you how much I love you. And this isn't any kind of burden for me, because I love who you are very much. Every time I remind you, I get to remember with you, which is my pleasure.”
Author: James Lecesne

Quotes: “Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity.”
Author: G.K. Chesterton

Quotes: “The heart is an arrow. It demands aim to land true.”
Author: Leigh Bardugo,

Quotes: “When I look at my life and its secret colours, I feel like bursting into tears.”
Author: Albert Camus,

Quotes: “There is a saying in Tibetan, 'Tragedy should be utilized as a source of strength.'
Author: Dalai Lama XIV

Quotes: “Jane, be still; don't struggle so like a wild, frantic bird, that is rending its own plumage in its desperation."
Author: Charlotte Brontë ,

Quotes: “Life is a beautiful magnificent thing, even to a jellyfish.”
Author: Charles Chaplin

Quotes: “What are you going to do? Everything, is my guess. It will be a little messy, but embrace the mess. It will be complicated, but rejoice in the complications.”
Author: Nora Ephron

Quotes: “Is it fair to have given us the memory of what was and the desire of what could be when we must suffer what is?”
Author: Neil Jordan,

Quotes: “I address you all tonight for who you truly are: wizards, mermaids, travelers, adventurers, and magicians. You are the true dreamers.”
Author: Brian Selznick,

Quotes: “People, generally, suck.”
Author: Christopher Moore,

Quotes: “Jace?"
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “I know not all that may be coming, but be it what it will, I'll go to it laughing.”
Author: Herman Melville,

Quotes: “My only love sprung from my only hate!
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: “Music is ... A higher revelation than all Wisdom & Philosophy”
Author: Ludwig van Beethoven

Quotes: “Love the world and yourself in it, move through it as though it offers no resistance, as though the world is your natural element.”
Author: Audrey Niffenegger,

Quotes: “But-" Maia, still looking at Alec and Magnus, broke off and rasied her eyebrows. Simon turned to see what she was looking at - and stared.
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “Man is the cruelest animal.”
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: “Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.”
Author: Anais Nin

Quotes: “Hello, Harry" said George, beaming at him. "We thought we heard your dulcet tones."
Author: J.K. Rowling,

Quotes: “I am free and that is why I am lost.”
Author: Franz Kafka

Quotes: “Clary felt suddenly annoyed. "When the self-congratulatory part of the evening is over, maybe we could get back to saving my best friend from being exsanguinated to death?"
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “That's the thing about girls. Every time they do something pretty, even if they're not much to look at, or even if they're sort of stupid, you fall in love with them, and then you never know where the hell you are. Girls. Jesus Christ. They can drive you crazy. They really can.”
Author: J.D. Salinger,

Quotes: “You live like this, sheltered, in a delicate world, and you believe you are living. Then you read a book… or you take a trip… and you discover that you are not living, that you are hibernating. The symptoms of hibernating are easily detectable: first, restlessness. The second symptom (when hibernating becomes dangerous and might degenerate into death): absence of pleasure. That is all. It appears like an innocuous illness. Monotony, boredom, death. Millions live like this (or die like this) without knowing it. They work in offices. They drive a car. They picnic with their families. They raise children. And then some shock treatment takes place, a person, a book, a song, and it awakens them and saves them from death. Some never awaken.”
Author: Anaïs Nin,

Quotes: “If we listened to our intellect we'd never have a love affair. We'd never have a friendship. We'd never go in business because we'd be cynical: "It's gonna go wrong." Or "She's going to hurt me." Or,"I've had a couple of bad love affairs, so therefore . . ." Well, that's nonsense. You're going to miss life. You've got to jump off the cliff all the time and build your wings on the way down.”
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quotes: “I will take the sun in my mouth
Author: E.E. Cummings,

Quotes: “The worst type of crying wasn't the kind everyone could see--the wailing on street corners, the tearing at clothes. No, the worst kind happened when your soul wept and no matter what you did, there was no way to comfort it. A section withered and became a scar on the part of your soul that survived. For people like me and Echo, our souls contained more scar tissue than life.”
Author: Katie McGarry,

Quotes: “لا تجزع من جرحك، وإلا فكيف للنور أن يتسلل إلى باطنك؟”
Author: جلال الدين الرومي

Quotes: “A trap is only a trap if you don't know about it. If you know about it, it's a challenge.”
Author: China Miéville,

Quotes: “I don't hate you.. I just don't like that you exist”

Quotes: “I've begun to realize that you can listen to silence and learn from it. It has a quality and a dimension all its own.”

Quotes: “What else? She is so beautiful. You don’t get tired of looking at her. You never worry if she is smarter than you: You know she is. She is funny without ever being mean. I love her. I am so lucky to love her, Van Houten. You don’t get to choose if you get hurt in this world, old man, but you do have some say in who hurts you. I like my choices. I hope she likes hers.”
Author: John Green,

Quotes: “Spring is the time of plans and projects.”

Quotes: “It's so much darker when a light goes out than it would have been if it had never shone.”

Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quotes: “God does not play dice with the universe; He plays an ineffable game of His own devising, which might be compared, from the perspective of any of the other players [i.e. everybody], to being involved in an obscure and complex variant of poker in a pitch-dark room, with blank cards, for infinite stakes, with a Dealer who won't tell you the rules, and who
Author: Terry Pratchett,

Quotes: “You are all the colors in one, at full brightness.”

Quotes: “I clench his hands to the point of pain. "Stay with me."
Author: Suzanne Collins,

Quotes: “People do not change, they are merely revealed.”

Quotes: “Help others without any reason and give without the expectation of receiving anything in return.”

Quotes: “Remember this: Nothing is written in the stars. Not these stars, nor any others. No one controls your destiny.”

Quotes: “It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.”

Quotes: “There must be something in books, something we can’t imagine, to make a woman stay in a burning house; there must be something there. You don’t stay for nothing.”

Quotes: “مش مهم انك تغير الكون... المهم انك تخلي الكون ما يغيركش”

Quotes: “Open your eyes and see what you can with them before they close forever.”

Quotes: “It is easy in the world to live after the world's opinion; it is easy in solitude to live after our own; but the great man is he who in the midst of the crowd keeps with perfect sweetness the independence of solitude.”

Quotes: “We learn from failure, not from success!”

Quotes: “I didn’t go to religion to make me happy. I always knew a bottle of Port would do that. If you want a religion to make you feel really comfortable, I certainly don’t recommend Christianity.”

Quotes: “Life has no remote....get up and change it yourself!”

Quotes: “I don't care," Clary said. "He'd do it for me. Tell me he wouldn't. If I were missing-"

Quotes: “Is man merely a mistake of God's? Or God merely a mistake of man?”

Quotes: “Scars have the strange power to remind us that our past is real.”

Quotes: “Lord, what fools these mortals be!”

Quotes: “What is that feeling when you're driving away from people and they recede on the plain till you see their specks dispersing? - it's the too-huge world vaulting us, and it's good-bye. But we lean forward to the next crazy venture beneath the skies.”

Quotes: “In times of grief and sorrow I will hold you and rock you and take your grief and make it my own. When you cry I cry and when you hurt I hurt. And together we will try to hold back the floods to tears and despair and make it through the potholed street of life”

Quotes: “There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact.”

Quotes: “Silence is so freaking loud”

Quotes: “If the person you are talking to doesn't appear to be listening, be patient. It may simply be that he has a small piece of fluff in his ear.”

Quotes: “Happiness always looks small while you hold it in your hands, but let it go, and you learn at once how big and precious it is.”

Quotes: “You will hear thunder and remember me,
Author: Anna Akhmatova

Quotes: “You think the dead we loved truly ever leave us? You think that we don't recall them more clearly in times of great trouble?”

Quotes: “If all the world hated you and believed you wicked, while your own conscience approved of you and absolved you from guilt, you would not be without friends.”

Quotes: “You know it's never fifty-fifty in a marriage. It's always seventy-thirty, or sixty-forty. Someone falls in love first. Someone puts someone else up on a pedestal. Someone works very hard to keep things rolling smoothly; someone else sails along for the ride.”
Author: Jodi Picoult,

Quotes: “In the summer
Author: Nizar Qabbani

Quotes: “Never marry at all, Dorian. Men marry because they are tired, women, because they are curious: both are disappointed.”

Quotes: “I think you should be a child for as long as you can. I have been successful for 74 years being able to do that.”

Quotes: “For me, I am driven by two main philosophies: know more today about the world than I knew yesterday and lessen the suffering of others. You'd be surprised how far that gets you.”

Quotes: “The starting point of all achievement is DESIRE. Keep this constantly in mind. Weak desire brings weak results, just as a small fire makes a small amount of heat.”

Quotes: “The world was collapsing, and the only thing that really mattered to me was that she was alive.”

Quotes: “If you want to be happy, be.”

Quotes: “Instructions for living a life.

Quotes: “It's not natural for women to fight."

Quotes: “Laugh, even when you feel too sick or too worn out or tired.

Quotes: “Whatever you can do or dream you can, begin it.

Quotes: “There's nothing worse than waiting and not knowing what'll happen to you. Your own imagination can be crueler than any captor.”

Quotes: “There is a pleasure in the pathless woods,

Quotes: “if you love two people at the same time, choose the second. Because if you really loved the first one, you wouldn't have fallen for the second.”

Quotes: “The worst thing about new books is that they keep us from reading the old ones.”

Quotes: “You always have a choice. It's just that some people make the wrong one.”

Quotes: “Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.”

Quotes: “If you don't go after what you want, you'll never have it. If you don't ask, the answer is always no. If you don't step forward, you're always in the same place.”

Quotes: “Black hair and blue eyes are my favorite combination.”

Peace has its victories, but it takes brave men and women to win them.”

Author: Robert J. Sawyer,

Quotes: “There is nothing like looking, if you want to find something. You certainly usually find something, if you look, but it is not always quite the something you were after.”
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,

Quotes: “Yes, we praise women over 40 for a multitude of reasons. Unfortunately, it's not reciprocal. For every stunning, smart, well-coiffed, hot woman over 40, there is a bald, paunchy relic in yellow pants making a fool of himself with some 22-year old waitress. Ladies, I apologize. For all those men who say, "Why buy the cow when you can get the milk for free?", here's an update for you. Nowadays 80% of women are against marriage. Why? Because women realize it's not worth buying an entire pig just to get a little sausage!”

Quotes: “We are all born mad. Some remain so.”

Author: Adolf Hitler

I want to be a woman and to be a man, to have many friends and to have loneliness, to work much and write good books, to travel and enjoy myself, to be selfish and to be unselfish… You see, it is difficult to get all which I want. And then when I do not succeed I get mad with anger.”
Author: Simone de Beauvoir

Quotes: “The Voice

Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,

Quotes: “The present changes the past. Looking back you do not find what you left behind.”

Quotes: “If you try to fail, and succeed, which have you done?”

Author: Nicholas Sparks,

Quotes: “أسوء تعذيب فى العالم هو الشخص المُصر على الكلام بينما أنت مُثقل بالهموم , ترغب فى أن تبقى صامتاً وأن تصغى لأفكارك.”
Author: أحمد خالد توفيق

Quotes: “livid,
Author: David Levithan,

Quotes: “Threats are the last resort of a man with no vocabulary.”

Quotes: “There were always in me, two women at least, one woman desperate and bewildered, who felt she was drowning and another who would leap into a scene, as upon a stage, conceal her true emotions because they were weaknesses, helplessness, despair, and present to the world only a smile, an eagerness, curiosity, enthusiasm, interest.”
Author: Anais Nin

Quotes: “Imagination does not become great until human beings, given the courage and the strength, use it to create.”

Quotes: “None of us knows what might happen even the next minute, yet still we go forward. Because we trust. Because we have Faith.”

Quotes: “I'm not lost for I know where I am. But however, where I am may be lost.”
Author: A.A. Milne,

Quotes: “Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.”
Author: Robert Frost

Quotes: “I don't know where I'm going, but I'm on my way.”
Author: Carl Sandburg

Quotes: “Winter is the time for comfort, for good food and warmth, for the touch of a friendly hand and for a talk beside the fire: it is the time for home.”
Author: Edith Sitwell

Quotes: “Anti-intellectualism has been a constant thread winding its way through our political and cultural life, nurtured by the false notion that democracy means that
Author: Isaac Asimov

Quotes: “Listen to them, the children of the night. What music they make!”
Author: Bram Stoker

Quotes: “Ideally, what should be said to every child, repeatedly, throughout his or her school life is something like this: 'You are in the process of being indoctrinated. We have not yet evolved a system of education that is not a system of indoctrination. We are sorry, but it is the best we can do. What you are being taught here is an amalgam of current prejudice and the choices of this particular culture. The slightest look at history will show how impermanent these must be. You are being taught by people who have been able to accommodate themselves to a regime of thought laid down by their predecessors. It is a self-perpetuating system. Those of you who are more robust and individual than others will be encouraged to leave and find ways of educating yourself — educating your own judgements. Those that stay must remember, always, and all the time, that they are being moulded and patterned to fit into the narrow and particular needs of this particular society.”
Author: Doris Lessing,

Quotes: “Dreams are the touchstones of our characters.”
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quotes: “In the end that was the choice you made, and it doesn't matter how hard it was to make it. It matters that you did.”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “Stepping onto a brand-new path is difficult, but not more difficult than remaining in a situation, which is not nurturing to the whole woman.”
Author: Maya Angelou

Quotes: “I am not interested in being original. I am interested in being true.”
Author: Agostinho da Silva

Quotes: “Love: It will kill you and save you, both”
Author: Lauren Oliver,

Quotes: “There is no point treating a depressed person as though she were just feeling sad, saying, 'There now, hang on, you'll get over it.' Sadness is more or less like a head cold- with patience, it passes. Depression is like cancer.”
Author: Barbara Kingsolver,

Quotes: “After all, Ginger Rogers did everything that Fred Astaire did. She just did it backwards and in high heels.”

Quotes: “An intellectual? Yes. And never deny it. An intellectual is someone whose mind watches itself. I like this, because I am happy to be both halves, the watcher and the watched. "Can they be brought together?" This is a practical question. We must get down to it. "I despise intelligence" really means: "I cannot bear my doubts.”
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: “If everyone demanded peace instead of another television set, then there'd be peace.”
Author: John Lennon

Quotes: “You don't love a girl because of beauty. You love her because she sings a song only you can understand.”
Author: L.J. Smith,

Quotes: “Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.”
Author: Oliver Goldsmith,

Quotes: “That was enterprising," Will sounded nearly impressed.
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quotes: “She was ready to deny the existence of space and time rather than admit that love might not be eternal.”
Author: Simone de Beauvoir,

Quotes: “Stars, hide your fires; Let not light see my black and deep desires.”
Author: William Shakespeare,

Quotes: “Book collecting is an obsession, an occupation, a disease, an addiction, a fascination, an absurdity, a fate. It is not a hobby. Those who do it must do it. Those who do not do it, think of it as a cousin of stamp collecting, a sister of the trophy cabinet, bastard of a sound bank account and a weak mind.”

Quotes: “The main reason Santa is so jolly is because he knows where all the bad girls live.”
Author: George Carlin

Quotes: “You can't lie to your soul.”

Quotes: “I have never met a man so ignorant that I couldn't learn something from him.”
Author: Galileo Galilei

Quotes: “It matters not how strait the gate,
Author: William Ernest Henley,

Quotes: “Our imagination flies -- we are its shadow on the earth.”
Author: Vladimir Nabokov

Quotes: “What is honor compared to a woman's love? What is duty against the feel of a newborn son in your arms . . . or the memory of a brother's smile? Wind and words. Wind and words. We are only human, and the gods have fashioned us for love. That is our great glory, and our great tragedy.”
Author: George R.R. Martin,

Quotes: “Like all magnificent things, it's very simple.”

Quotes: “You know, some people think Shadowhunters are just myths. Like mummies and genies." Kyle grinned at Jace. "Can you grant wishes?"

Quotes: “I will have you without armor, Kaz Brekker. Or I will not have you at all.”

Quotes: “Everyone has secrets. It's just a matter of finding out what they are.”

Quotes: “One should always be drunk. That's all that matters...But with what? With wine, with poetry, or with virtue, as you chose. But get drunk.”
Author: Charles Baudelaire,
